ORsTDzYlSYd1yBmf3RJFSQ.text: Archi's simply rocks! I have tried several other places that are closer to me but I always end up driving back across town to Archi's because it's just better.  The staff is always friendly and efficient.  The food is always amazing.  The Thai basil fried rice is a must have...but then so is the beef salad and the yellow curry.  The flat rice noodles with pork is to die for.   I am waiting for the day they open a location on the east side of town!  Till then, I will keep going back to Archi's Thai Kitchen cause I just gotta.

_SWfw2LrU6Dd192xVFMvSA.text: Great place to go for Thai food.  Good quality, authentic, tasty, and reasonably priced.

6Gyjw_r80eiystvEv-UTrQ.text: I dined here 6/20/08 and had the worst service ever!  I have actually been eatting here for the last 4 years and use to go to the original location on torrey pines and flamingo, and since they have opened the one on rainbow and 215 i have been going there instead.  I ordered lard na, and it was served to me chunky with a weird odor.  I tasted it and it was disgusting, I called the server to switch my order and explained to him and her that the noodles were either burnt or old one or the other.  I have ordered the dish in the past and it has never tasted or looked like the way they served it to me that day.    The waitress said if she takes the food back it would be a lost to the business and she would have to pay for it!  I was shocked, apalled and offended with her response.  I am not one of those customers that eats all their food and then sends it back for a free or different meal.  The plate was practically untouched and still she refused to take it back, saying it was business policy.    I asked for a manager, which she said wasn't there.  I am very fimilar with the establishment and knew that Archi himself would be at the other location working, so I had her give me the number to speak to him myself.    I explained to Archi the situation, and he too said that they never ever take food back, and that his cooks prepare meals the same way every time.  I am of south east asian descent myself, and I know exactly what the dish is suppose to look like, and last but not least I have eatten there before with out the burnt and odor smell.    It wasn't until I told him that I would put a bad review, and that I worked in the F & B industry was when he said that they make exceptions once a year.  Thats bull if you ask me.  If you are in the area try kin paow on rainbow and windmill, price is comparable and food is much better than archis.  If you disagree, the day any of  you ever dispute the food trust me you will be upset with their "business policy!"

uFwLxmFdGnQq70mFEFe_fg.text: Love this little thai Kitchen.  My favorite Thai restaurant in all of Las Vegas.  I especially like this location, not their other locations.  The food is always up to my standard, and I have eaten a lot of thai food from all over the place, including in Thailand.  The place is small but very clean, the service is fast, and wait staff very frlendly.  I have recently moved far away from this place but I still continue to drive to it whenever I need a Thai fix.

LO_daNxEBn3YXUebllOfNA.text: For the one time I have been ......... Fantastic Food!  Service was quick, friendly and they constantly followed-up to see if I had any additional needs.  Ordered the Pad Prik King with Chicken and the Beef Salad at a 7 for both on the spice scale.  Had a nice kick to it but not over powering.  Tons of flavor in both dishes.  The thing that was most noticeable was the use of fresh ingredients in the Beef Salad.  It literally just reeked of freshness.  Would highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be back the next time I am in Vegas!

UMMWuiQCcmRPVVhzR8XYFA.text: food good, service quick.... were were looking for a dinner spot before our next show and we decided to give this place a try since it had good reviews and multiple locations.  we were in a hurry to eat dinner so we can make it back to the strip for the next show and we made it with no problem even after be held in traffic on Flamingo road due to DUI control roadblock.  It was just after the super bowl so I guess this a good thing.  Anyways, the service was friendly and fast.  We had they Pineapple curry and Phad Thai.  The Phad Thai is among the best we have ever had.  The noodles were firm but not rubbery and the sauce was not too sweet or sour.   The curry was good too....a little on the soupier side but was smooth and spicy.  Maybe it's because it was made from powder rather than paste.  Their brown rice was just okay.  A little too fluffy for my liking.  All for under $20, what a great deal.  I even made it to the show with time to spare.

jl0Opvo034VmnOx3YqfLoA.text: Wow!  This place deserves the best rating you can give it!  The food was delicious, plentiful, and authentic!  And as detailed by so many other diners, it is SPICY!  We ordered everything at a hot level of "5" and could have probably ordered a "3" or "4."  We asked if anyone ordered it hotter, and our waitress told us that some order it at a "25" or "30."  I'm not sure I believe that, because it has to be impossible to survive even a "10" at this place.  Anyway, the service was great, the place was clean, the food was awesome, and I'll go back if I find myself in Las Vegas again.

7yALzQoGYRMAepxS_EGSEQ.text: love archi's!  both locations!  my favorite is their spicy basil fried rice.  you can give them a spice rating from 1-10, and they are usually pretty accurate.  their eggplant dish is great and their pad thai is perfect.  we usually get a variety of their apps, including their satai and thai toast.  service is very friendly and efficient.

RYzgBFAfvb8gfrfMnpFn_Q.text: Honestly, I do not understand why this place is getting such rave reviews. If you have eaten good Thai food before then you will understand that this place is not that great. My friend and I found all of our dishes (2 starters, 2 mains) to be over-cooked, tough, greasy but cheap. If you are visiting Vegas and staying somewhere on the strip, this is really not worth the taxi journey off it. Invest the cash for somewhere that might be a bit more pricey but worth it.

lI6z8J9ixW7R0rJGH-jR2Q.text: After the all the great reviews here, we just had to check out Archi's. We fly into Vegas once a year for a convention and we are always looking for a great place to eat "off the strip". We did Lotus of Siam last year. Archi's has a lot to live up to. Took a $20 cab ride out here. Food is good but not great. Menu is a bit sparse. Green curry was very average. The ginger beef dish was very good and so was the salad and the chicken satay sticks. We don't need a full bar in a restaurant, but they'd probably get more business if they served beer and wine. You cannot buy ANY alcohol here at all so we settled for tea and water. Had to wait forever to get a cab back to the strip. Overall, food is probably a 4 1/2. Location and decor is about a 3 1/2 . Service was very good. Overall, a good restaurant, but nothing special and for the $40 cab ride out and back, we feel the Lotus of Siam has this place beat hands down, due to closer location to strip and much more interesting menu.

bIZDmsLZf3Mr-d9fmidKRQ.text: An enjoyable casual dining experience. My Wife and I enjoy the YenTaFo.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Early Anniversary dinner with my lovely bride and lovely mother.

x89aUGqzo4YRGkjoUkJflw.text: I will give credit where it is due and the one star is for the absolutely delicious food. HOWEVER, the service is absolutely lacking UNLESS you're a dine-in customer. I called ahead to order our food since my coworkers and I only have an hour to grub. I specified this as soon as I called, was allowed to place my order and as soon as I repeated that I would be there at 11:40, she said "Oh no, we can't do that. You can only order ahead if you're picking up." Doesn't make a lot of sense considering that regardless or whether you call it in ahead, or call it in as a pickup, you're still making the food and you're still taking the chance that the folks who ordered may not show up. We show up and request to be seated. We were told we could sit, but we weren't met with politeness AT ALL. We had to ask for water and chili THREE times and was treated horribly by one waitress in particular, so much that I felt it necessary to speak to the young manager, Chris. I explained to him that regardless of being a dine in or pick up customer, we were still a paying customer and would have left a cash tip but were treated horribly. He continued to make excuses about their policy and how they want to keep their dine in customers as dine in and the pick ups as only pick ups. Bottom line, we showed up, we paid, and we asked for service and were met with deplorable service.

1K_B6DzPQMbzpdp4sFT8GQ.text: Best Thai food I've had in a long time.  Vegetable Panang was delicious, and chicken fried rice also top notch.  Service was good, location convenient, atmosphere quaint, and staff nice.  Highly recommended.

irKj1gQCowpM23HYU_J_wA.text: Really nice clean comfortable place. Ordered Pad Thai- with tofu. Big plate of tasty Pad Thai, too greasy for my tastes, though. Good service. Fast and friendly. My friend got the stuffed wings- ok he said, nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-l92cuYJh_9mbJHhnBuphg.text: Very disappointed!!! I called to place an order over the phone, she told me to wait after 15 minute wait I decided to hang up and order my food inside restaurant. Already being annoyed with the fact that I couldn't order my food over the the phone. I had to wait an additional 15 minutes for my food which I completely understand, but it all could have been avoided if they were of taken my order over the phone. What really pissed me off was the fact that I had to wait standing, the employee said we don't have a waiting area. Yet I saw plenty of empty tables. Clearly they do not care. I love the food but after this experience I will never go back.

LfmEKbu1DOztiZh5KrfEYw.text: They have a couple of locations in town by far this is my favorite location! Not as packed as the other ones better customer service and they give you larger portions of food! So far everything I've had has been very very good... Be careful the spicy goes up to 10 I got five and my lips are burning a little . Enjoy

MHq32hRQFE1JZDybYTmgjQ.text: I love Archi's! I come here whenever I am craving pad thai. It's delicious and it's ready fairly quickly. I still have yet to find a better place to get thai food.

u6Z16yBJK9qyNB_rRxHDsA.text: This is the place to go for Pad Thai! The fresh spring roll is really good too as an app. When we dine here the food comes out very quick and hot (temperature). It's also very convenient to order up how spicy you want your dish using a 1-10 scale with 10 being nuclear reactor meltdown hot. If you are looking for good Thai good, go to Archi's.

5seXdntEzsI8rRU0yYPhJQ.text: The food is really good but the wait time is way too long for lunch. We ordered ahead and came in at the appropriate time they said it would be done. We waited for over an hour to get our food to go.  The place was full but I will not be coming back here for lunch.

vAooI8hNoB-7Wofeojz_Mw.text: When craving Thai food this is the place I run to. The spicy eggplant and pad Thai are my favs. Very clean atmosphere as well

0GlZ5TPArglUbD57lmMDtw.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. The inside is pretty clean and the food has traditional flavors. Servers are efficient even if they aren't all that friendly. Definitely order a side of peanut sauce, cause it goes with everything. I really liked the way they decorated the restaurant. It felt authentic. Prices are ok, but no real bargain.

4KEcH8ZkAJrQoUKasprBqQ.text: Cute restaurant. Thanks to Wondering Steve on you tube. Pad Thai was delicious. Pannage curry was off the chart. Great rich creamy flavor. Great chose. Great restaurant, clean, classy, great waiter.  Good menu choose.

hHu3BPys-hyBcev1BzkYCA.text: This has got to be the best Thai food on the west coast. Everything is amazing. The summerlin location was the one to rope me in. Busy, electric vibe. Great for eat in or take out! Located next to a movie theater and pottery place as well as ice cream. Great family location.   Here at the original location on flamingo and it's a totally different vibe. Reminds me of the Chinese place Tracy eats in 'Oh God, book 2' where she says good bye to George burns (aka God). It's swanky, peaceful and very zen.   Today I'm picking up take out for a work pot luck. Pineapple curry ( with chicken) #2 spice. Warning. #4 made me cry. But I loved every drop!! And pad Thai with shrimp, also #2!    This is a great place for a date night. Super close to the strip just Down from the palms. I've tried about 1/4 of the items and it's all to die for!  My only complaint is they aren't in Henderson!! But worth the drive!!  Vegas is Hot in the summer but Archie's is always the Hot spot for Thai food.

a0t--7ejKaXK3j_EOQNHrg.text: This is the BEST Thai food that I have ever had and I have travelled the world. Thanks Archi's for always giving 100%!

zJ9IgbYlcKufnBWAPK8HOQ.text: This is a very nice Thai restaurant. Tasty food, modern ambience, beer and wine license,  attentive service, and reasonable prices. Would go there again to try other dishes, as well as recommend to others.

17BSJTcts4QgRbg6hv9_Uw.text: same great food as always but prices have gone up quite a bit. $4.99 delivery fee is ridiculous.

MDjDYB_ZId1DkF1No_R-4A.text: Small, quaint place It was nearly empty when we came in on a Saturday afternoon. Great food and service was fine. Definitely will come back for more

cHaQeGuri69JUO21ZYHVCA.text: When a co-worker said "Hey, what about Thai Thursday?", I said I'm in. Then to find out we were going to Archi's was even better. I didn't know there was more than one location, so that was a pleasant surprise, as I had never been to this location. My pepper steak was good, although the "4" wasn't as spicy as I was anticipating, so I will bump it up next time. The lunch combo comes with soup, an egg roll and a won ton. Good portion, good price and good food. One in our group ordered Sweet and Sour something and didn't get her meal until the other seven of us were almost done. The other meals just kind of filtered out to the table as they were done. It's kind of hard to eat with friends when everyone is getting their meal at different times. I am definitely a fan of Thai Thursday and will be back. A more prompt delivery of the meals and this is a four star experience.

QojRISoAXlHyoonl0iIv0A.text: Bet Thai Iced Tea and Coffee anywhere! Great food, too! We always stop in whenever we are in Vegas. Service is excellent, prices are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Curry Beef lunch special and an Iced Thai Coffee!

sg8qXw_VzB_etIYC4pPS_g.text: Very good food and service!  I was ordering the pad thai, until I tasted the yellow curry. OMG!  I wasn't even into curry, but yum yum yum! You really need to try this dish! I can see why they have multiple stores!

disE_9jayKMSmwttWXcp1w.text: Portions were quite generous (we were stuffed beyond belief) and the food was top notch. Great service too. I typically like medium spicy food. I ordered my larb and my seafood green curry as "7" and I was ON FIRE. Mind you, both were so damned good that I ate them and just let my mouth flame. My other half ordered pad thai - it was huge. for dessert we had the mango mochi as one yelper suggested - it was quite yummy and was an effective means of cooling of my flaming mouth. I would come back here in a heartbeat. I wish the east coast had thai this good!!!

HO5OUKHG5fOYDTLECKU6lA.text: A MUST, and i mean A MUST when i go to back to vegas.  how often does one find an authentic restaurant? NEVER  my dad and i stumbled upon this place and its very very very dear to my heart. though my dad isnt a fan of coconut i make sure we get the Tom Ka, along with the Padprick King Beef and the Red Curry.  my little sister adores the coconut ice cream and will stop by just to get it sometimes.  they level their spicy-nes from 1-10 and though my dad can handle a ten i cant even take a 4.5   the waitress's are nice and though the place is small ive never had to wait more than 5 minutes to eat.  i really do love this place. i really do.  i have yet to try the  one 215 and rainbow but im sure its good.   dont be in the mood for thai on a monday because they are closed.

Bg8KF_8WJ6KP-AAC8iAi0A.text: Great food. A little Americanized but great nonetheless. Noodle dishes are the absolutely best I've had, and I'm a pad thai junkie. Not too sweet, not too spicy (Unless you alter the spice rating), it is perfectly balanced. The meat dishes are perfectly seasoned as well. I haven't had a chance to try the curry, but I've seen a lot of other diners eating it and I've heard a lot of great things about it. For appetizers, the stuffed chicken wings are my favorite. I don't know how they do it, but it's two, over sized drumsticks stuffed with noodles and vegetables, fried golden brown and served with a tasty plum dipping sauce. You have to try it. Also, in my opinion, Thai cuisine has the best fried rice amongst all Asian countries. Try Archi's pineapple fried rice and tell me you don't agree.  The location on W. Flamingo is the original spot, its extremely small and accommodates about 25-30 people max. But the decor is very "homey" and full of great people. The service is friendly, attentive and helpful. The new location off of S. Rainbow and the 215 is a whole lot bigger, but food and service is as consistent as the original location. If you love Thai food, you have to try this place out.

xTK3ihwExCshiYhxtC42qw.text: Amazing! I think the soup cured my horrifying hangover... Seriously it was so yummy that I wanted to barf repeatedly just to eat more. Also, the delivery guy knew English!

DEvAPGUPbrEv-bk1vAEM3A.text: Hungry for Thai food, I checked this website for some suggestions in my area and all I can say is "Thank you".  This was a great recommendation and I will definitely be back.  I got the Pineapple Chicken Curry as take out and loved it.  Very fresh flavors and the staff was nice. I am already looking at their menu, trying to decide what to try next.

HyIwd3a2-cu_UMxQB_AU1Q.text: It's nice to find a good Thai restaurant in Vegas.  I didn't expect much from this place, it it some what surprised me.  I love the tomyum soup and the coconut chicken soup.  Yes, I am that crazy about soups :)  The food here was pretty decent.  Some of the items could be better, but you know what, we ordered 7 dishes and only 1 of them wasn't too good.  That's more than what I expected :)

sWdUSy3YQx4Im7FDusnHPg.text: Well, I guess the Yelp peeps has got it right again! Not only yelp said it ... Zagat and Michelin said so too. Once I saw the signs, I was like .... this will be a good dinner.   We ordered the fresh spring roll for appetizer, crab fried rice, mixed veggies with beef, and spicy basil with pork in "medium" spiciness. The appetizer was an interesting combination of chinese sausage, cucumber, and fish cake(?) - the taste with the sauce was interesting to say the least. It is worth a try if you don't want that fried stuff once in a while. The crab fried rice was one of the best I had, the price is very reasonable for the amount of fried rice we all had. The veggie beef was tasty and the beef wasn't too chewy IMO, and the spicy  basil pork, though was spicy, the taste was there and it was PERFECT with white rice. Yes we got white rice on top of the generous portion. Too bad that our hotel has no fridge nor microwave ....... we could not bring it back.  IF I wanna eat Thai in Vegas, we will be here again

dal7IT3VV72syrBAuo8yhg.text: I was in Vegas for the night, and had called my cousin out for dinner. We had initially wanted to go Italian, but at the last minute decided that Thai was a better option. The window sticker suggests that this is the best Thai food in town, and leaves room to wonder whether it really is. We started with the fresh spring rolls, and ordered pineapple fried rice w/ shrimp, spicy eggplant (which they label as eggplant spicy) w/ tofu, pad pak w/ chicken, and the pad kapow w/ beef.   To start, the spring rolls were rolled with a non traditional rice sheet, and were not made with the usual ingredients. Even the peanut sauce seemed a bit lacking. The spicy eggplant had just enough grease to make it delish, and the fried rice was to die for. I barely touched the pad pak, and almost steered clear of the pad kapow - like eating mashed up beef patties. Despite the less favorable dishes, I am still craving me some Archi's!

jKUeWNjh9jRyOLHV32UBvQ.text: I went to this location only to find out, they have a location close to my house.  Fortunately, I was heading to the strip so it didn't matter.  Started with the beef salad.  It was nice and fresh with a nice light flavorful sauce.  I asked it for 8 out of 10 on the heat scale.  I didn't find it hot, so if you like spicy, order everything at a 10.  I also had an order of combination pad thai and penang curry.  The pad thai was the weakest of the dish.  A little on the dry side.  I ordered the curry at a 10 and it was nicely executed with decent heat, definitely not hot as I wanted.  The food is good quality but a little "white washed".

2VvLlu6AlVax1U7DpRvexg.text: BAD ASS Thai! (Sorry maybe i should have used that description with thai food) but it is GREAT! The key things I look for in Thai and other ethnic foods are 1. Quality 2. Taste #. Consistency! if this restaurant has met these criteria I will frequent these places always...and I do! Every trip to vegas after finding this place I have eaten here! Never disappointed and food is always great! Don't get me wrong...Hawaii has its share of good thai food but this place...for some reason BEATS them every time!

jWHMp7hBmR5ApoqPIbcs_Q.text: This is where I go when I crave Thai. It's convenient, even has a drive thru when I order take out. Go to items on the menu: pineapple fried rice, Tom kha soup, pad Thai, pad see ew, papaya salad and chicken larb. My husband liked the ginger chicken. He's not a big Thai food fan. Their Thai iced tea is great as well.

HDHr_e-mhve-isYXateC0Q.text: This place deserves 5 stars based on these 3 things:  1. AFFORDABLE PRICE: My parents, sister and I visited this place on a Sunday night while visiting Vegas for the weekend.  We ordered soup, pad thai, chicken larb, seafood salad, stuffed chicken wings, sticky rice, thai tea and thai iced coffee.  The total bill was $64!!!  $64 for a complete meal with soup, appetizers, sticky rice, drinks and noodles is pretty dang good!  Not only that, but the dishes weren't dinky and were plentiful!  The Thai Tea and Thai Iced Coffee also came in huge glasses. So much that my parents didn't finish their drinks and had to take it to go.  I'm used to a very fat bill with small portions every time I visit a Thai restaurant back home in California, so $64 looked great to us.  2. GREAT FOOD:  Not only was the place very affordable for a Thai Restaurant, but it was amazingly delicious.  BEST CHICKEN LAAB/LARB I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE! (From a restaurant, that is.  I still think Mom & Bro-in-law makes the best larb in the world).  It was a perfect combination of salty and sour.  I find that some restaurants make it too salty or don't add enough of that larb stuff..... rice powder/toasted rice powder.  I immediately tasted a hint of rice powder and asked my mom if she did too... just to confirm it.  They also added just enough cilantro and greens to add that fresh herb taste to it.  Everything was in perfect unison.  It was just damn PERFECT!  Everything else was great; Tom Yum Soup was flavorful, seafood salad was fresh, pad thai was also delicious and the sticky rice was heaven!  It was kept in a bamboo warmer and had that home quality taste just like the way Grandmas makes sticky rice.  We ordered a 4 spicy on a scale of 1-10 and it was just perfect.  It was pretty spicy for a 4, but it was just about right.  We got our pepper kick without totally burning off our tongues.  I come from a family that eats spicy food, so I recommend asking for 3 or lower if you can't really take the heat.    3.  GREAT SERVICE:  I was put in charge of searching for restaurants to go to during our trip, so initially, I was thinking about taking my parents to a more fancier, "Best Thai Restaurant in the Country" place.  But last minute, I decided on Archie's because of the reviews that stated this place was a small, family owned restaurant.  Knowing my parents' preference and my own as well, I knew we would enjoy the food and atmosphere of a small restaurant.  The 2 waitresses were super friendly and often checked back on our tables to see if we needed anything else.  They also came back around to refill our water twice.  The only negative about Archie's is that it's away from the strip.  It's not too far, but its a few miles.  Also, the restaurant is located on a very dark shopping center.   The shopping center was deserted and.... kinda creepy.

6knXv8jZT0l8La8tJEdGeQ.text: Dissizzsum good Thai food.  Ordered 5 different dishes, with varying heat from 3 to 7.  The satay appetizer and pad Thai are some of the best I've had in Vegas as was panang curry.  Everyone enjoyed their dinner and service was great.  Will def return!

KoQKhYl9skJQP7I2TmANug.text: Very nice local Thai food place. Good service, fresh food and clean environment.

O-tOBZpw6QXmRdS-DEgixA.text: Best Thai ever-all three locations. Moved out of state almost a year ago and go back to Vegas for it.

iVk4LuJSm7qb2sNGngA_rw.text: Mom and I are big fans of GOOD thai food.. This was NOT good. The Tom Kha (coconut milk / lime soup) was average but the shrimp was undercooked. The chicken satay was terrible.. Fatty and lacking that Thai spunk .. The Red Curry was flavorless.. Their prices were on the high end compared to .. Say .. Panna.. In SW Vegas... Except Panns is so tasty you'll be dreaming of your next visit back before your meal is fully digested. Definitely disappointing trip based on other reviews..

RohtWufKsWKPnUOtyu22Aw.text: One of my favorite Thai places in town. Great food and great lunch specials. They have good service too.

Eh90U355_2kGR0eyCzU-og.text: I do not miss Vegas, but I definitely miss Archi's.   I used to go to Archi's about once a month with the ex, and we would order Thai iced teas, either the red or yellow curry tofu and the basil tofu, each at level 7-9...mind erasingly good. Unlike most Thai places, when you ask for spicy they give it to you on the Thai scale rather than the 'yeah right, whitey' scale, which I've come to recognize as a mark of respect. The service was always terrible and the place is tiny, but the heavenly food makes up for these mortal flaws.  I know this constitutes blasphemy, but in terms of vegetarian Thai food I think Archi's holds its own against Lotus of Siam.

6lmDA7ZjP38GDivkE6YtSQ.text: 4.5 Stars I asked what was best and was told the Thai Chicken with basil.  It was really delicious and at $8 for dinner a good deal too.  It's a good 4 star rating but with the good price they deserve and extra half a star.  I will be back for sure.

b5kUxWBwTp0e7MmuruVRgg.text: The food was pretty good, but decor needs help. The tablecloths looks as though they haven't been changed since the restaurant opened.

l4BZG1nx1l0jaRMocLyTHA.text: This is probably the 10th time I've eaten at this location on Flamingo Road. I felt like that I have to write a review since every single time I come here I have a great experience. I had to Pad Thai shrimp which is absolutely delicious they probably have the best Pad Thai that I have tried in a long time. I also ordered a curry shrimp bowl for my friend which she loved.                                      They also have a ginger soup that comes with the lunch menu special for a 95. the place is pretty busy for lunch and it's located near the 215 and Rainbow Boulevard. definitely one of my favorite Thai places to eat.

ST_RxFuBFPg2-mZz_qupkw.text: I've never had any bad food here! I've been so many times over the years and the food is so good! They have many different locations all over vegas so I can always have my fix wherever I am! I am on a record to try everything on the menu!

1RDerEQpiiS4Uid8hotY_w.text: Love this place. Servers are always very nice. Food is delicious and they also have a drive up window service for call ahead orders. Been eating here for years now. Cashew Dish, yellow chicken curry and Curry Fries Rice are our favorites!

2oE6wZV3Wwaq6hEgb6aWGQ.text: I came here with my family the service is so so slow there is a about 3 guys in the front just talking don't attend us I have to call one of the guys to attend us with drinks ... their very slow to attend us but very fast to get us out of here ...

9oMeo9pYT_m4y94-nkSlfQ.text: Unassuming from the outside pleasantly decorated on the inside. I came here for lunch on a Sunday and was pleasantly surprised. Service was good my water glass was always full.

6x448OLpUCy1JV1ikerJAQ.text: Love the fried rice and chicken padthai is the best , everytime we have eaten there are food is always hot and fresh never had a bad experience

r3oMWtcYKglOtrpi21QBrg.text: Just what I was looking for as a frequent business visitor to the Las Vegas area.  Great thai food plates, great service and pretty close to my work-stay lodging.  Tasty rice without abusive spice that can easily set Thai off of my choices for dining out.

0uLca4ZEN6r6JscNM3d4fg.text: We had a 12 people party, and the service was pretty good. ocZNWr0MXzPkZt1EhvXaKA.text: This place is my go to Thai restaurant. I loveeee everything on their menu and the price is reasonable. Their fresh coconut is very refreshing and delicious. Their Thai tea is also one of the best Thai teas I have ever tried.

zOFocNuF_le6eukx-smG_Q.text: I ear here atleast 3 times a week. The food is absolutely amazing. The staff is always very courteous and helpful.  Just all around great atmosphere and again the food is amazing.

LlKEvqXnVqupGKR3kUq9nA.text: Stop by to having lunch ..hungry for Thai spicy soup ..It is taste so good hot & spicy !!!! Yummy..have to wait for little while because this restaurant is very popular..they always busy but it ok to wait for good food !!!

ev-vCRjM_57bD32G7yK35g.text: I have had food from one of their other location and figured this one would be just the same. Sike  1. They have a pretty cool to-go/pick up window 2. The workers seem younger and less patient then their older counterparts at the fancier locations 3. They dont take directions 4. Rude  When I place an order over the phone im usually looking directly at the menu. Now the menu they have online looks like some fuzzy picture of a picture. I ordered 2 orders of pad thai, one chicken one house(with all meats). NO NUTS. Which I reiterated twice no nuts. Ok 25 min, k great.  As I arrive to pick up my order Im met with a heafty $27. Yikes. The menu says 6.95 ea. Im quickly told that was the lunch price and the dinner price was 9.95 and 12.95 for the house pad thai. Wowzers i said, I didnt see any dinner prices on the menu. Well dinner started at 3pm. Hm interesting. As i pay him he hands me the food, shuts the window then walks away.. Um wtf how did you know i didn't want my change back?  Rude.  Once i made it home i opened the containers hoping the tasty food would calm my nerves and what do i see.. Nuts.. Nuts.. Why me. I'm not allergic or anything but i did state twice I didn't want any on either order. After that initial let down my boyfriend and I check the menu again.. Im right, no dinner prices and it looks like a picture of a picture.  The food was okay but for the hassle I'm sure I can find a place with a friendlier staff and less grease.  Also know for lunch specials you will get cheated out of soup if you do take out. You will still have to pay the same price, but no soup. I even tried to negotiate an extra wonton or egg roll since there was no price difference but no deal.  As if 11/28/15 looks like the menu is up to date visually and the prices more accurate.

Xi7MkMGiIQqZIWoLHHzhGg.text: 3.5 stars rounded up.  Quiet Thai place with good food! Came here for an early dinner and the restaurant was pretty quiet! It wasn't empty, there were several groups of people eating but I guess everyone was just eating verrrry quietly :)  FOOD: - pad prik king with pork (spicy level 10) - yum! And most definitely spicy! The heat doesn't really hit you until you eat more of it, but when it does woooo-eee that's good! Green beans were still crispy and the dish wasn't too oily. - pad kee mow with chicken (spicy level 10) - this wasn't as spicy as the pad prik king but still very yum! Good breather from the spiciness.  SERVICE: Decent. The servers seem a bit lackadaisical but the restaurant wasn't crowded anyways. We had to ask for water refills, and for the fish sauce & chili mix. They never brought us that little tray with the sriracha either!   An older couple came in when we were eating and they appeared to be regulars since the staff welcomed them very warmly and brought out a dish without them even ordering. So sweet to see :)  VENUE & LOCATION: Restaurant is home-y. We sat in a booth and the chairs look very cushy. Plenty of parking all around.

Cons: first of all this is totally opinionated so make your own judgement on the following statements: I was not as intrigued by the flavor combinations. I've ordered my three dishes (pad Thai spicy string beach chicken and Panang curry) at many Thai restaurants  and this restaurant has to have my least favorite in flavoring. It was very under seasoned for me personally. All I rated in the Panang curry was coconut milk whereas other places I get a more fragrant herbal smell and overpowering taste. Also the chicken was completely over cooked I had to chew on it like it was bubblegum. IFiC1a3fqZoUmDGzg-lW-Q.text: I was impressed by this place.  I've been wanting to try this place for a while, and I finally got the opportunity to last night since I was around the area.    The place itself is small, but not crowded.  It was very clean, nice decor, and nice ambiance.    We had the Thai Toast, Beef Jerky, Chicken Pad Thai, Panang Curry, and the Pad Prik Pow.    Started with the Thai Toast and Beef Jerky.  The Thai Toast has minced chicken and shrimp inside with cucumber salad on the side.  I had mistaken the cucumber salad for dipping sauce, but it was still good.  I say cucumber salad is good dipping sauce for Thai Toast.    The Beef Jerky had the perfect combination of tender and thick.  Full of flavor.    The Chicken Pad Thai came in a huge plate.  I say it's good for at least 2-3 people, depending how hungry you are.  On a spicy level from 1-10, the spicy level we ordered was a 7 and it was spicier than I expected!  I absolutely loved the flavor.    I ordered the Panang Curry with a level 5 spicy level (out of 10).  Again, also spicier than expected, which is awesome.   Last, I had the Pad Prik Pow.  This also had a spicy level 5 out of 10 and spicier than expected.  I had to order some Thai Iced Coffee to cool my taste buds.    Archi's Thai was a great experience with great food, and great ambiance.

MMAtC4CDX6b8OfrqmqseLQ.text: So my friends have been begging me to try this place because I live down the street and I figured what the hey I'll bite. My boyfriend was stationed in Thailand so he is verrrrry picky. I am on my way home from work and decide I'm going to call in an order. So i call and order the spicy eggplant with pork (recommended by the girl on the phone) an order of Thai wontons and an iced Thai coffee. I show up in 15 minutes and wait for maybe about 5. Service is amazing. So friendly and sweet. Gosh that's hard to find in Las Vegas. She brings out my iced coffee and I'm in love. It's so yummy. I believe it's made with condensed milk which is why it's so amazing. I get my food and go home . They have put plenty of napkins and two forks. Awesome. We settle down and begin to eat. Omg the spicy eggplant is a 10! It's amazing I prefer it a spicy level of 8 and it was perfect. Just enough heat for me. I tend to love spicy food the hotter the better I was scared of 10 but I think I could try it next time. The wontons were mixed with pork and shrimp and they were decent nothing to complain about. The eggplant  stole my heart. My boyfriend also loved it all. So Archis has faithful customers with us!

nqwKC-LwylRvVQh1K1m0CA.text: Always have had a great dinner here & at the other locations in Vegas.  Food is plentiful & delicious!  The staff has always been super friendly.

mR7JwhqR5TaNRSTOlRFeDQ.text: WE LOVE ARCHI'S!!!!  We were in Vegas one year celebrating our anniversary and we were craving good Thai food.  The front desk lady at the Venetian recommended Archi's.  So taking her advice we tried this place out.  Since then, we try to hit up this place whenever we are in town.  I swear this place is sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo  yummy!  :) :)  Their yellow curry is exceptionally good and very flavorful. I highly recommend it.  We typically order their Pad Thai and Pad See Ewe and Satay as these are our favorite Thai dishes.  Archi's does a great job with them all.  Everything we have tried thus far has been awesome.   We look forward to eating at this place whenever we come to Vegas.

MMWSO9kimNggciC_7BarjQ.text: Love the food!! Delicious & authentic!!  I've been to all 3 Archi's Thai, here in Las Vegas. I go to Archi's Thai Kitchen more often than the other 2 because this location has a 'drive-thru' and that's awesome. I'm in and out of the house all day, everyday, and it's great that I can call this place up and they have my order waiting for me at the drive-thru 15-20 mins later. Very practical. For the most part, the people have been polite and friendly at this location. I definitely have no complaints when it comes to the food. Always delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

rbg7HjX0rfyBEQojGEBsew.text: I wish they would open up one of these in San Diego- WOW, it was soooo good.  Had to deliver some of my art to a collector in Vegas, and we picked Archi's for dinner, as the other place we read about out near it was closed (ended up being a lunch only place) But I'm glad it was, this place was such a find. Read about it from Yelp on the iPhone while searching for something else nearby.  And at first we were a bit hesitant, the name didn't sound all that Thai, but it went well with the modern/clean decor, which made the atmosphere very nice. It's much nicer than your standard Thai restaurant for sure, and the staff was very friendly, every one of them.   The food was spectacular, very fresh and came out quickly. Appetizers; spring rolls and stuffed chicken wings, and it went uphill from there. I liked they asked what level of spice you wanted (1-10), but I just asked for 5 and asked for the spice so I could add to my liking, and they brought out a whole array of them, so I added different ones at will.   All dishes were superb, for the wife and myself both (we split the dinners, Chinese style as usual), and I can't wait to go back and deliver the next batch of art there, just so we eat here. It was about 15 minutes from downtown, as we stayed near the airport. (VEry clean Hampton Inn for only $44 a night by the way, w/ breakfast!).

3SfKfcB1mAe461cZ3WCGaA.text: Best Thai food I've had.  I've had  few small restaurants in Henderson and East Vegas that were sub par.  Was introduced to Archi's by some friends and come back to eat every time I visit Vegas.  They marry the perfect spiciness to sweet in their Pad Thai.  Not overly greasy, very fresh and authentic along with good service.    I used to work up the street so came for lunches about once a week.  Had a nostalgic food moment, so I had to write about it.    Chicken Pad Thai (get it SPICY!!) - Winner.  Good Thai Ice Tea as well.    Reasonably priced.  I believe they have a fullbar, so you can get your drink on if you'd like.

enJ7hCpw5S1Vik0GZDQd2g.text: I am convinced that Archi's has influenced a lot of Thai restaurants in town.  In my opinion, this old restaurant has set the standard for Thai restaurants that stay moderately authentic, while at the same time appeal to the general public.  In my opinion, Archi's is a solid Thai restaurant, but it lacks the uniqueness and higher level of authentic Thai that I look for in a Thai restaurant.    My Thai friend who is a cook told me that Archi's has good stir fries, but forget about the curries.  So, I thought I would try both.  We ordered the Thai tea, which was excellently balanced with sweetness and cream, the pad cha cha cha, the panang with chicken, and tom kha with chicken.  Let's start with my favorite dish, the tom kha!  I loved the tom kha (khi)!  It has nice whole shrooms, with basil and a fairly good amount of lime juice, along with other yummy herbs.  The coconut milk was generous, and very creamy.  I think it could have been made a little more sour, since I prefer my khi's to be puckeringly sour!  However, underneath Thai Grill, this has to be one of the best tom kha's I have had.    Next up is the pad cha cha cha, which is a mixed seafood stir fry dish with a lightly spicy teriyaki sauce, and bamboo shoots.  The teriyaki sauce itself was a little bit on the generic side, but tasty enough to enjoy.  What did wow me though was the freshness of the squid.  It was nice and soft, not chewy at all!    The panang, which I have heard was good from different people (and not so good from my Thai cook friend), was in my opinion an excellent version of the standard panang you'll get at any Thai restaurant.  It also reminded me of the chu che salmon at Thai Style Noodle House, but with a little less character.  Overall, it was tasty, but not overly unique.  I still think Thai Grill has the most unique curry flavors to date.  However, compared to other Thai restaurants, this version of the dish has a nice balance between sweetness, coconut milk, and herbs.    I struggled between three and four stars with this review.  However, Archi's has long been the favorite for a few Thai people I know, but today there are a few better restaurants out there.  For the sake of their history though, and their ability to help make Thai food popular in Las Vegas, I am settling on a four star rating today due to the previously mentioned facts, and that awesome tom kha!

nmYNwqiRSj0l5YWrhNXl3g.text: My husband and I love this place. I think everything here is really good. The pad kee mao is very good. The Tom yum soup is very good as well although I wish they had it in a smaller portion so I could just have a cup of it as an appetizer. Also the pineapple curry with shrimp is very good. I really enjoy going here.

eYvk_e34f5cWBvzWmgx4_Q.text: i love this thai kitchen. i had the red curry with beef here with the spice at 7. it made my nose run, but i could probably go a spice higher. i introduced my parents to this place who never ate a lot of thai and they loved it. my mom (picky eater!) is a big fan of the cashew chicken and gets it on the regular now. i found it to be very tasteful. my dad tries different things all the time and loves the spice factor. it lingers on your tongue so weak stomachs beware. the thai ice tea is really sweet and a treat all in itself. i had to share it otherwise it would have filled me up completely. the service was nice and attentive. we went on a weekday afternoon and there was only 2 other tables filled. i cannot wait to go back for lunch soon and try my favorite thai dish, the pad see ew with beef. definitely a thai place to eat at!

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red curry. spice set at number 7!

HPgZXhZNvG9aoHrPVWFvbQ.text: First off I always compare thai food to ping kaow, it's just how my mind works and it's a good reference point for comparing vegas thai food  I have been here 3 times now and it has been solid every time.  I do like pin kaow better overall but this place is still well worth eating.  The lunch special is fantastic and I had it with red curry and it was great..  The tom kha gai soup here is awesome and probably better than kaow.   The reason I like pin kaow a little better is there pad thai is probably the best I have had and pad thai is one of my favorite things in the world so there you go.  I would bet that half the dishes are better at one place and the other half is better at the other.

nJ5_uhI3Kd9yEjBjwFRBrQ.text: I remember when Archi's first opened back in 2003-2004 and it was this little hole in the wall Thai place not many people knew about. I only knew about Archi because I own the hair salon (self promo : haircolorxperts las vegas) in that same shopping center. Though the years have passed since Archi's opened, the quality and service you get have always remained constant. The prices have increased about $2 dollars over the years, but I will still remain a loyal Archi's customer. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because they are closed Mondays, and I can't get my Thai tea.   PS: They have the best thai tea in town.

cZ6nZEfJMKc5VI3QN38HUw.text: Best thai food on the west coast. Seriously. I got their spicy level 10 on my Pad see yee and was in spicy hell heaven.  It's restaurants like these that keep me excited in vegas when I'm bored with the fancy schmancy places in the casinos.

q-qZZZfhLDwGN6eCDaXQww.text: Archi's is my favorite Thai Restaurant in town.  I would have given this location 5 stars, except it is the smallest restaurant I have ever seen.  Sometimes the wait can be 30-45 minutes. Other than that the food is EXCELLENT.  The Red Curry is so rich and flavorful, it is probably my favorite.  The Tom Kha soup is sooo good, the Pad Thai is great.  The service is excellent, and the prices are reasonable.  Go for lunch, they have excellent lunch specials for $6.95.

uG2e5bl8uu1YaGUDWqcLtQ.text: This is damn good Thai food. Better than Ping Kaow, if that means anything to anyone.  The Pad Thai was perfect in my opinion, noodles were perfectly cooked, not mushy or too hard, I asked for a spice of 7 and still ended up putting more chilies in it - loved the look on the waitresses face when she saw that, Oh You want it more spicy, she asks?! Why yes I do!  Speaking of spice, they spice cart had a nice assortment of pickled Thai peppers, not the jalapenos you see at the other places. Nice touch, Also had an interesting sauce that I think she said was fish sauce and garlic with pepper flakes. Whatever it was, it was good. I've only eaten there once and will definitely go back to try other dishes but from visit number 1, the food, the service and overall charm of the place, I highly recommend it!

3qydFiauoCKoXre4ckt5UA.text: Food is delicious, but Service get very slow at times. Also had an incident of when a waitress hit me in my head with plates and when my husband argued about it with her she said it was my fault for not keeping my head out of her way.

eTtonswGBhEMOuq8PZ4rGg.text: Last night, my family and I had dinner here. The place was clean, orderly, and the staff was very cordial and friendly. The dishes didn't take long to receive either. That was a super good thing because I was stupid hungry after a 6hr tattoo session! I don't remember how much it all cost because my bro (THANKS BROSKI!) snatched and covered the bill before any of us could grab it. I'd recommend this restaurant to others. I'm sure they'd enjoy it as much as we did. I would have given them 5 stars if the portions were just a lil' larger and the chicken was sliced instead of ground. Tastes the same but I like that texture better.

dotnFaKWSQ_Kl5HXRgJurA.text: Coming from LA, Thai capital of the US, my level of Thai food snobbery is high. Unlike the scores of pad thai fans, I prefer to judge Thai restaurants on green papaya salad. It's hard to fake freshness with this dish and corner cutting on the prep is obvious.  In addition to my standard test dish we also ordered fish cakes, chicken larb and sticky rice. We went for #4 in spiciness.  The food came out promptly. The papaya salad was quite fresh, peppered with dried shrimp and green beans. The taste was akin to that of the Bangkok street stalls. The fish cakes were also quite good and contained bits of either onion or leek. You could tell the slightly gritty ground rice in the larb was homemade instead of rice powder out of a jar.  The heat scale was the real deal and 4 was perfect.  It's good to know I now have yet another great Asian food option in the City of Sin.
