FqS0w49LWFMPn4eoUFhqWg.text: I heard good things about ARCHI'S and last time I came on a Monday they were closed but now open 7 days a week. Unfortunately it was just standard Thai Food that I can get anywhere I want in Los Angeles, and the Pad Thai was a bit too sweet... Our Tofu appetizer was decent... The #6 spice wasn't spicy and I know this because I don't like Spicy Food...

wOstMRVom0qP7FoFWfwVwA.text: The food and staff are great. Everything I have eaten so far has been fabulous.

cPNrBct09PSY3M35DX_wpg.text: Everyone stays on the strip in vegas but we found a gem off the strip! This place is really good! It's nice a quiet, the price isn't too bad, and the Thai food is legit! :)  Warning: When they ask "how spicy?" they have a 1-10 level. 10 being most spicy. We should we could take it since we usually we medium spicy level so we asked for a 6. The waiter looked at us and said that we should get a 3. We said are you sure? we can take spicy food! And he said trust me! So we asked for a 4 for the tom yum soup. The soup came out and a 4 was spicy!   We went back the next day because the food was so good and that time we ordered tom yum with a level 3. Perfect! :)  I don't know how spicy a level 10 is but I'm glad we listened to the waiter the 2nd timea round.  I would definitely recommend you to check out this restaurant if you go to vegas!

kmgF6wyaBCVW7zcNuHBjgg.text: Been to Archi's for years, Waited tonight for along time without even a glass of water, finally got up walked out and goto Applebee, They have wonderful server there... It's not the owner's fault, but with terrible servers... If I can't count on the restaurant who have a standard of good service, will not bring any other friends there...

9oAOlRzGEngVlsrFBFIbRQ.text: Well the food is so so not really good I was eating lunch with all my family this morning And the food was terrible and the server is unfriendly ...

hJbrItQ7GaeKhUXn0uEAyA.text: The first time I tried this restaurant was almost 4 years ago.I am of a Thai and Chinese origin so I have been eating Thai dishes all my life. I know that the restaurant doesn't really target Thai person but still they should make at least decent food. My friends and I ordered green curry,stirred-fried spicy flat noodle.The green curry was a bit watery(green curry supposed to be a bit thick and creamy with coconut milk),the spicy flat noodle was so so and the way they cooked the flat noodles was not quite the way it supposed to cook..The service was ok not excellent.  I was there once and decided not to go back there again.To me the only good thing about this restaurant is its ambience.

v0S7Vom2fvtrIhwASbxgjA.text: Archi's is the best Thai joint in town!! All my local friends have told me so and I believe them! Their lunch special is from 11am-3pm (3pm, i think?) and it comes with salad, soup, and an eggroll + your chosen dish for about $7.00.  Whatever you order, from the curry to pad thai to papaya salad, the server  will ask you "How spicy?" The scale is from #1-10. I like medium spicy, so i usually ask for spicy level # 6. If I feel like I want medium spicy that leans towards hot, I'll ask for level #7.   Since this place has 3 chains all located in different parts of the town, it makes it very convenient to get your Thai food fix wherever you are. The ambiance of this place is very soft, clean, and inviting. I love dinning here. I always feel like I am at a resort. You know what i mean when you check this place out.  Side note-- If you have a big party, I suggest you go to Archi's Thai Cafe (located on W Sahara Ave). Its a bit more open and spacious. Archi's Thai Kitchen is a bit small and on the cozier side.

7a9bZeaXXry2rVC9G9gf6Q.text: This place is beyond amazing, the staff is super friendly, the restaurant is very well maintained and neat and the food is delicious. The wait time was a lot shorter than expected and the staff was super courteous. This is a must visit!

Ca2uiZcv28bMyQXbdabJmQ.text: Food was amazing. Very spicy. Love hot food and got 5/10 which was still very hot. Highly recommend even though its off the strip a bit.

ax7Q514jNfZJ1JsjzvtKqw.text: I've had home made thai food,  and this was the first time I've been out for it.  I was not disappointed.  This place was excellent!  The food was great,  the service was good,  and the prices were very good.  We ordered the spicy basil,  red curry, pad thai, chicken satay,  and stuffed chicken wings.  Everything was absolutely fabulous.  We will definitely visit this restaurant again!

iKL3S5TBIZ8RtNOQG599pg.text: I've been here twice and had great experiences both times.    First time, a friend and I shared yellow curry, pad thai, and eggplant.  Everything tasted great.  Second time, I ordered TAKE-OUT yellow chicken curry, rice, and a thai tea for about $11 total.  The yellow curry was delicious and lasted me for 3 meals.    Really nice place for sit-in or take-out.

eCtG89lL9MKh8ax9SpmOjQ.text: Had lunch here last week and the silver noodle salad was scrumptious. My husband had the yellow curry and really enjoyed his too.  Service was good but it was a bit noisy as it's a small place.  Well worth the occasional wait.

uV20xIjH7uZSVoQTnS6Q0A.text: One of my favorite Thai places to go to for lunch.   Extremely cheap and really delicious food.    The service was pretty quick, my girlfriend and I were seated in a booth right away and we took advantage of the lunch specials.    Each of our lunch specials came with soup (cucumber soup?) which I downed quickly and a salad.  I ordered a beef and curry dish while my girlfriend chowed down on her pad thai.   I liked this place's pad thai better than Lotus of Siam's however I still crave Lotus' beef penang..mmm.  The Thai Iced tea served here was well made here too.

oX7G5fL3i1t1nDTI5bbz4A.text: After remembering coming to Archi's and having a delicious meal, I convinced some of my friends to trek across town for some Thai dinner. However, after eating here, I wonder if I was struck with early memory loss because our meal was varying in degrees of deliciousness.  Hitting nearly dinner time, the place wasn't too busy, so we were seated immediately. The waitstaff were very attentive in refilling our drinks and answering miscellaneous questions. One of my friends ordered the Yellow Curry (heat level at 3/4) while the other ordered Pad Prik King (heat level at 0 - she's a big wuss when it comes to heat). I decided to get my favorite, Pad Thai (heat level around 5).  All of our dishes came out on a timely basis, but some were let downs. My friend's curry lacked much of its heat and also much of its flavor. Literally, the Pad Prik King had more spice than his curry - sad considering what they requested heat wise. He ate a majority of it, but set foot to devouring our dishes instead. The Pad Prik King and Pad Thai were good, but nothing extraordinarily spectacular. Our mounting hunger after watching two movies resulted in both the noodle dishes' demise, but all three of us agreed that we've had better elsewhere.  Ultimately, Archi's is not what I remembered it to be years ago. Prior to my first visit two years ago, I kept hearing so many accolades for this place, but after this recent visit, I'm not sure if it's well-deserved.

wYWYW6DQoDzwcLltF62N1Q.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant. The food is amazing and the setting is very pleasant. Whenever I come here, I always order the Pad Thai, Kung Pow, Red Curry, and Tom Yum soup. All of them are delicious. Sometimes the food takes a bit long to arrive, but is absolutely worthwhile.

uJmWbEphDw-ngtN5U3WhMw.text: No complaints yet about Archi's. Pin Kaow used to be my favorite for Thai in Las Vegas, but their service has been slipping in the recent years. Archi's is always busy and the food is always consistent which means they're definitely doing something right. The lunch specials make it a perfect spot for lunch.

3TiDhkvU2bdk7r7E9lEFYw.text: Once of my favorite places.   It was the first Thai restaurant I took my mother in Vegas some years ago. She loved it then.   Fast forward a decade and the food was horrible, the service was worse.   I could write about all the ways our latest visit was disappointing but I don't want to waste any more of my life.   The next day we renewed our love of Thai food at Thai BBQ just down the street. A dive with lots of flavor, freshness and service.

bgcLhl8_mMrIGlbWqqvy1w.text: Good food and good stuff , i had a confusion in the check and they took care of that no problem good place for thai food

cIF2oRgaIaMwxltu6htz7A.text: Decided to try this place based on reviews and sad to say I probably will not try again. Got chicken laab and some egg rolls to-go... when inside to pay because the drive thru window is difficult to see and the host was not very polite... twenty bucks for the two items and portions were small!!!, we asked for Thai hot 10 and was not very hot... egg rolls weren't at all spicy... asked for a to go menu and was told to look online.. overall horrible experience and makes me definitely not want to come in and eat if this is how to go is treated.  As a first time customer I will be trying other places before returning here

1zwTs3LMIv5UlXi902i5kg.text: Thai food is my absolute favorite cuisine I would absolutely recommend the pad Thai noodles here. They cut the potatoes for their yellow curry a lil differently than I was expecting, but the taste and presentation of all the food is amazing. I highly recommend this place. The ONLY reason I felt inclined to give 4/5 stars is that while the wait staff was sometimes really attentive they were also somewhat very slow. Ended up waiting for quite a while for take out boxes and a check. I think one of the young gentlemen was actually very new so that's really understandable. Hoping everyone can be just a tad bit quicker and there seemed to be some preferential treatment between staff and other patrons I was seated near. But not a big deal. They were a larger party. Other than that my experience was amazing.

krpbSAMkQo9kR99u6YAOmw.text: Archi's had a charming, rustic feel to the place. On the inside, the decor relies much on objects placed in the room, and not fancy decorations adorning the walls. The paint looked old, and there were some patches on the wall. Overall, the restaurant looked clean and it was a little busy when we were seated.  Their food didn't really blow me out of the water. I have had better Thai food in Vegas -- the food here is just average. I had the yellow curry, which comes with jasmine rice and your choice of meat (I chose beef). They asked me for the spiciness on a scale of 1-10 and their 4 was just right; not too hot, but just enough spiciness to be flavorful. It was a filling meal, but there are probably better places out there with the same price range as Archi's. When it came to dessert, they had mochi ice cream on the menu. Unfortunately, the waiter told us that they didn't even serve it anymore (menu update?).   I'd probably come back because it's in close proximity to where I live, but I wouldn't say it's as amazing as all the hype it seems to have.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yellow curry (beef).
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6eEDwNZJCRuYnOpk8VBsfQ.text: Food quality is terrible! The meat was like old, not good at all.  I used to eat there a lot but not anymore.  I will tell everybody not to go here.  My food was really disgusting.  Was Pad See Ew and it was disgusting... never again ever!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Terrible food way too expensive.

7l1djwfNBCTJALnafOCvsw.text: My first time.  I enjoyed the food. The service was great.  I'll return. Good prices too.

S3q1BxFGVzpcqshOGKSy6A.text: If you want Thai food this place is the BEST ! I love their spicy chicken basil ! It is the BEST great prices too ! You gotta try it ! I just wish it wasn't so far from where I work lol

Rj1XnlTXIE_Tr5zDXkMUmg.text: Went in for lunch. Server put us in the back room. No one came by to take our order longer than 15 minutes after we got water. Not one single employee even walked into the back area. It wasnt that busy and there were 3-4 servers working. We left. DON'T SEAT PEOPLE IN THE BACK ROOM IF YOU'RE GOING TO FORGET ABOUT THEM!

Ln8WHCsA3B3hD-0SfjKStw.text: Been to Archi's twice for lunch with coworkers about two months apart. First time was great. Flavors were spot on and service was appropriate.   Today 12-19-2017 was our second trip. We placed our orders, and after over an hour, still didn't get my food. It was just a curry. No explanation from the waiter, no apology, no nothing.   We then asked for the bill and it was at that time the waiter brought my curry dish. I told them they can keep it at that point. Still no apology and no explanation.   Waiter also failed to offer refills to the rest of the group. Service was horrible today. I've had better service at fast food restaurants. Probably not coming back any time soon.

Yrx-An9Y7_8EVvsxufDVmg.text: First time trying this place, I ordered a pad sew ew. It came very quick and it was delicious!!!

aBkWDM2agL8wMwGNHiKH7w.text: I usually order from this location and food is good, but the last 2 times the food quality has decreased. Today my panang curry was extra salty and super greasy. Very hard to eat. Great customer service, but the food quality not that great anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry was extra salty and super greasy. Very hard to eat.

YViBMiJtb7Ib5Y6y6cz1cA.text: Group of five co-workers went for lunch and it was FANTASTIC!  Everyone loved their meal, wait-staff super fast and friendly.  Food was almost too hot (temp wise).  But I guess that's a good thing.

XdA3vY-jvNAr1vuJHTaJog.text: Excellent small Thai place the shrimp salad was great !!    You just feel healthy eating it , everything  is fresh and greens are crisp.  You feel even more alive by asking for it spicy!

m_ZzhNINUyk6iH98nlzOWA.text: Over the years I've been to all the different Archi's locations, and they've been my favorite Thai spot in town.  My go to dishes are Pad Thai, Spicy Beef Basil, Pad Kee Mow, and Chicken Panang Curry. You can order the level of spiciness from 1-10.  I've been to this location many times, but my last couple of visits were disappointing. The food took over 45 minutes to arrive, and the service wasn't that great. On another occasion, I waited about an hour. I've been coming to Archi's for quite some time now, and they're a 5 all day, but this location gets a 4.

BIQ9O5E5kB14dEH89GgZVA.text: I'm a True foodie.. so visiting Vegas I Uber'd 15 min to this restaurant. I ordered the typical red chicken curry. The worst I've ever had honestly one spoon full I dished out was all bamboo and one piece of extra dry almost paper like chicken. I asked politely to just order something else not sending the dish back with worries that my good would be tampered with... don't waste your time nor money

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WqWFk5UOAkAV3bO6H5p61A.text: Food was excellent.  Servings were good size and shareable.  The pad Thai was excellent. Just the right amount of spice with number 3.  The yellow curry looked a bit watery, but the taste was all there.  Ginger chicken was good.   Was not a fan of the vegetable spring roll, but others liked it.  Overall a great place for Thai food that is very reasonable and very good.

8TKnuIfMe5W1fMqzpKKtSw.text: Ever been in a relationship you knew was not good for you, but you stayed in it because you were affraid of the unknown? If your answer is "yes", than you know how I am feeling about the Archie's Thai Kitchen and Bistro. I've been going to these Archie locations for over 10 years.   LIke most relationships, it was a good start. Good quality food, and good service, and a fair vaue for Las Vegas.  A place that I could always count on for good Thai food, take visitors, and suggest to others.   Now, the story is slow service with a poor attitude, reduced portions, not properly prepared, and sometimes served cold; and unexpected charges on the bill, for minor entree modifications. No longer the reason you want to dine out.   Just like waking up to a significant other who has "bad breath", finding dirty underwear on the floor, or going into the bathroom, and finding it in a "need for Lysol cleaner" condition, my experiences at Archie's tell me it's time to move on.  So, why have I not moved on?  "Fear of the unknown".  After watching "Dirty Dinning" on the local news cast, I have concluded that there is a good chance I may pick a Thai place that has, or will be suspended by the Health Department, or is in a neighborhood that you can't find a cat on the street.   But as a wise person once said, "Better to be misrable by yourself, than be misrable with someone else".    It's time for me to "break up" with Archie's and take my chances in the world of Thai Food.

QGHmWqNSdfcqNev-uRV8MQ.text: Every time I come here, food is always on point. My favorite is Spicy Basil with Ground Pork. They give good amount and the quality is always fresh. The Thai Tea is just a tad bit too sweet for me considering I love sweets thus the 4 stars. But over all experience is always good, the service is fast. And I'll keep coming back here again and again.

lYVVOWA-slVHBGvlPZMzdg.text: I learned Thai food from Archi's, and I always return to Archi's after trying other Thai restaurants.  My favorites are Thai Tea, Pad Thai, Papaya Salad, Panang Curry, and Pineapple Fried Rice!! I usually visit the one on Flamingo, because it's close to my house, but ones on rainbow and sahara are just as delicious:)

r2UCXjgxz9PIVAs-sJlhGg.text: Food and Service very good.  Ran into a few dishes we were not crazy about, but overall recommended.

Fj5Yi62MrkIhF3abVLJ5jw.text: I was not impressed with this Thai restaurant. The ambience was missing, and the service was severely lacking. My friend and I decided to give it a try after hearing many good reviews, and it was a mistake. We came there at lunch time and had to wait to get seated. The place was extremely small and dirty. There were many pieces of food thrown about on the floor and the odor was not very pleasant. Eventually, when we got seated, the waitress was rude; she threw the menus down on the table and did not provide any pleasantries.   Our food was average at best. The spice levels were completely wrong. I like my Thai soups at 3 at most, and it came out at 6. Upon asking the server to amend this mistake, we were met with attitude and frowns, even though I was very polite about my request. The food was okay, but I didn't feel that it was fresh tasting. In fact, the rice was rather dry and traditional Thai drinks were tasteless.  I didn't really like anything about this place. Maybe, I'll give it another try at its other location, but I am never coming back to this one.

WnOg7aSHPguYvPp3nKz5eQ.text: My husband and I finally decided to get take-out from this place after hearing great reviews.  Plus the actual drive-thru is very convenient.  I had the yellow curry, my usual Thai order. My husband had red curry (whatever it's called at Archie's). We were kinda disappointed! My yellow curry was very bland. It didn't taste like anything. I tasted the actual flavor of the chicken, which without seasoning, doesn't taste that great, let me tell you. I added salt to it at home, which did not help. My husband didn't like his curry either.  We really wanted to like Archie's, since it's cheaper than our usual go-to take out place (Jasmine Thai on Buffalo Rd). But we decided we'd rather pay a little more for better curry at Jasmine Thai. Maybe we just ordered on an off night, but it wasn't great.

f0vofiqfXEh4uf2zfFhJOA.text: this place is gooooooooood! very fresh. small but good. ordered ground chicken n basil, crab fried rice n spicy beef salad.  Its one of my favorite thai spots in vegas. Its clean food. I like lotus of siam too, but sometimes that place gets a little dirty. So for me, Archies is a safe bet for my tummy.

vk5nzSm-YsDmfnoLdupGTg.text: My boyfriend and I just moved to San Francisco from Vegas. We've tried sooo many Thai restaurants here and NONE compare to Archi's Thai Kitchen on Flamingo. Archi's Pad Kapow is something we CRAVE but simply cannot find in the bay area and we are sooo sad. We are seriously going through Archi's withdrawal. ARCHI'S, WE MISS YOU TERRIBLY!

yAO9B2LOIxzlilMBYGxPNQ.text: Authentic! People rate this place 3 & below don't know nothing about Asian Food! Lol ;D

hKAG0TMYiujij_jHlDxG6w.text: AHHHH! I absolutely love this place. My cousin and her husband who practically eat anywhere and anything at anytime they want because they can afford it told me this is one of their favorite restaurants. And after trying it out for myself I can definitely agree! Let me start with the interior, this location is sort of has an odd stand alone building in the middle of a parking lot for a shopping center. But the inside is really nice because it's like your Aunt's classic living room, which has a nice home feel to it. I ordered the Pad Thai, which was in the lunch specials part of the menu. Let me just say the best Pad Thai I've ever had! Amazing flavor! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it! Service was good too and always good to know since Asian restaurants can be really rude sometimes. I recommend this place to everyone and I have been ever since I've tried them. 5 stars well deserved!!

OPr8qTWRMP3CN7FJF7DpxQ.text: Can you handle the heat?  After reading some of the other reviews,I went with 3's and 4's on my order.  I had carry out Beef Salad, Pad Kapow with chicken, Spicy Eggplant and Thai Iced Tea.  Despite going low on the number values for spiciness, I gotta say that even 3's and 4's still kicked my butt.    The food is good and the service is friendly.  Just be sure to order a lower number than usual!

ZwTkZUS67YFjvbfEoHd-rQ.text: the food is OK...not great,but not bad..the problem is they are cheap...Ordered trays for takeout (4 servings per order ) and they stiffed me on the rice...over $200.00 worth of food and the get kee neow over rice...F them.....

_uchSlbTWACHTu4IdKGIIQ.text: Wifee says ' I want Thai '. Ever obedient, I grab the iPad, load the Yelp app and search for Thai. Archi's rates highly, but there's three Archi's I note. Eeny,Meeny,Miny,Mo. Archi's Thai Kitchen it is. Jump in the car with wifee, teen daughter & fussy eating 10 year old.  It's easy to find and great parking. Two cop cars outside, I park right by them thinking they were watching the neighborhood and the car will be safe. No cops in the car! Hum?  Go into Archi's and law enforcement were chilling at a table and seemed to be enjoying a plate of Thai food. The restaurant is bright, not large and reminds me of where you would eat your breakfast in a Hoilday Inn Express. I don't think that's a bad thing but it was very bright. Friendly server sits us immediately and gives us iced water. I order beer & Chardonnay as is my tradition. WHAT? NO BEER OR WINE? I sob..... It's clearly marked on the Yelp review but I didn't notice. Dumb. Anyway the food; we order Sesame Toast and egg rolls to start. The toast is deep fried and too greasy, egg rolls were fine. 10 year old McDonalds aficionado wants plain chicken , they fry him up plain chicken and it was great. Teen wants chicken fried rice and a Mongolian beef dish, ordered 3/10 on the heat/spice scale she thoroughly enjoyed it. Wifee ordered the same, but being a spicy food bigshot, she went for 7/10. Good choice, wifee happy. I take a chicken cashew dish , 5/10 (pathetic , I know ) and was equally happy. There were many Thai clientele eating and the place was charming. Great food, $70 before tip and we will be back to Archi's but I believe the other locations will give me a beer to quench my thirst and alleviate the heat should I go crazy and order my food 6/10 on the spice meter.

mNUhyN7mfn0KQt_A9y7n9Q.text: OH ARCHI'S ! You have a place in my belly. The service is great, the food is so yummy, prices are reasonable, I feel like its the best thai in town (just my opinion!)    It's addictive. Once you eat here, you'll want to pick up takeout a few days later. Yes it's that good! Oh, and to date I have never had to run home immediately following a meal IF you know what I'm sayin... I probably just cursed myself though. Oh and they opened one by my house on rainbow, but I still love the Flamingo location the best!!

fpsU7PEtRXyN65foqrIXwg.text: Love their tom yum chicken soup and the ground pork with basil. Server was good when the restaurant wasn't busy. They just plainly suck during peak hour. Overall, I forgive them for the sucky service after I get my tom yum soup and my pork basil. Restaurant is clean too so that's a plus.

x3V-o8TdTPOmHZUT4Cm3Xw.text: Love this place.  Eat lunch there once a week.  Red curry lunch special is only about $8 or $9 dollars.  It comes with soup, salad, rice, egg roll and the curry.  Nice decor, good service, low prices and tasty food.  What more could you ask for?

VLzS-gcUO3M8KD350vIlOQ.text: I wish I have mOar friends so I can order moAr dishes!! I can't get enough of the Pad Thai so I'm always content with just that.   Everything here is great!  When they ask you how hot you want it on a scale of 1-10, try going lower than usual because I think they eye ball the spiceyness-touch.  Either that or the cooks have no taste bud because they are hardcore smokers..  If you don't know where to start try their Panang Curry, Tom Kha (coconut soup), or Pad Kapow.   Their sister's property on Rainbow is just as consistent as the Flamingo one (original location) just bigger and newer looking.  They have a third property on Sahara that I haven't been to but I can guarantee it'll be just as good..   No refill on Thai tea ;/

_oR5cswef4sg-9R3AWjvbQ.text: My favorite Thai spot in Vegas! Hole in the wall, mom and pop. If you are looking for some real authentic Thai food, don't go to the fancy Thai restaurants on the strip and pay more when you can get the real thing for a fair price on Flamingo(and newer location on Sahara).   I usually order the Tom yum soup, papaya salad, and pad seew with chicken at every Thai place I try. All very yummy at Archie's.  There are spice levels from 1-10. 1 being mild and 10 being the most spicy. I ordered all 6 on the spicy dishes. I love spicy food, meaning I love jalapenos, habanero, Thai chili peppers. 6 was a little too spicy for me, but after a few bites, I got used to it. I think 5 would be perfect. At least you can add more of your own peppers to taste. I can't even imagine how spicy a 10 would be. I can imagine level 10 being on "man vs food".  The Thai iced tea was good, served in a huge glass. They do put tons of ice, so if you would like more liquid then ice, I'd tell them to lay off the ice a little. I personally like it with a lot of ice though. The thai iced tea also neutralizes the spicy hotness in your mouth.    The only negative comment I have about archi's is the bathroom. It's not very clean and there were no paper towels or extra toilet paper.  Go here for real delicious Thai.

t-PiNkHQWj7RCcMq7QI9ow.text: Disappointing at best- had fresh spring rolls, came wrapped in crepe not rice paper as advertised on menu- had pad Thai- kinda a big glob of noodles with a a few slices of carrot and green onion and no peanut garnish- nota keeper!!

eIZ4pJ7u1Dqc9bWMWWALAg.text: OMG this must be the best Thai place that I've been too.  Everything we tried was delicious. The food could be very spicy if you don't know the ranking. I eat spicy but #4/10 was way too spicy for me. Go with 1 or 2 to be safe. I did not like the soup since it was serve in a bowl, not one of the hot pot thing. The lard was my favorite dish. Thai tea is highly recommended since they did not make it very sweet and it was a huge glass. Most of people at our table togo half of the glass.  I did not like how the waitress kept forgetting how many people at our table and we always missed something.  This place is tiny so I would not recommend it for big group on Sat or Sunday.

VNOt76SOh1B6y4yeFfRQpQ.text: RE-DONK-U-LOUS-NESS!! Archi's rocks my Thai pallet.   There are two locations, I use the one on Flamingo for to-go orders & the one of Rainbow for dine-in.  Yellow curry chicken (you can specify how hot you like it), thai tea, delish!!!!!!!!

5eZ6c3-fcUus07SboYLx6w.text: The mother of all Thai food places.  I used to put Banana Bay (Hacienda Heights, CA) in this honor, but it has been demoted.  Being Vietnamese-American, I was drawn to the Catfish.  I usually have a 4 spicy but once I misordered and cried throughout the meal.  Too hot, to compose myself but too good to stop eating.    Service is wonderful for a date and also fast enough for a lunch treat (if you can fight the traffic at the time).  Besides their catfish, I recommend their curries, friend tofu, and Thai iced coffee.    They have a new location on South Rainbow, I heard.  Damn, right by my old house, too!  Well, the journey of the Nomadic TL continues!

FIaNQE67naQ429gYbaoNUw.text: This spot is probably the best Thai food I've had on the West coast.  It may be a small establishment, but the spices rocked my socks off! I especially enjoyed the pad thai w/ chicken + shrimp.  The Massaman Curry w/ medium spice level was delish as well!   I will definitely come back for more heat next time! YesSir.

s9t3lQh89GulcR68YJOfXQ.text: went last 2 days 1st.day July 6th. waited @ carry -out window 4 mins no one ever peeked out, no one even near the drive-thru window @ 7pm. went again today @ 7:30pm bad cust. service young girl mumbling, took my order to-go.. never smiled, never spoke, never said hello, real drab, could tell she didn't want to be there... her name on receipt (S.Tashakom) got home my whole order was wrong.Very stingy w/the meat like most Asian spots. trying to get over the customer. How much you wanna bet no one will ever contact me to make this right. most places in Vegas don't care .

cvjYUwmk8tg0-T6B5CkXdA.text: My second favorite of the Archi's locations around town. They have all the same great menu items. Some cosider this their favorite location because it's the original, but I enjoy the rainbow location's ambience and service slighty better. Still great and definitely worth the trip here though!   As with all the Archi's locations I stick with tofu, pork, beef and vegetable most of the time. The chicken always tends to be a little dry and overcooked. Just my personal opinion. Pad Thai, Papaya Salad, Curries, Tom Kha with Veggies and Thai Jerky are my favorites, but there really isn't a bad thing on the menu, except the Thai Macaroni, just stay away from that!  Happy eating!

oxjWbDsaS270_ZzZ4SXlyw.text: This is the BEST Thai food in Las Vegas! Consistent food and customer service every single time.  Yummy!!!

QVepRt2mss-PSsULQ5RpiQ.text: Have been enjoying their food for the past year, went for a business lunch at 11:45 and we sat there for over 50 minutes before any food came to the table. Two other tables had the same problem as us. We had the same service problem three weeks ago at their other location. Called the manager to the table and he wanted to lay the problem off on inexperienced wait staff ... as if that were an excuse in general, but it was the same waitress I've seen around the place for the past year.  Food tasted good, but the delay just makes it too hard to justify taking a chance when business is involved.

7YBRQnGdBsau1kMQA-Z9zg.text: Archi's is an old dependable.  Having been to 3 of the locations over the years, you get very predictable quality food at reasonable prices with pleasant service.  Short of having spectacular food, that's about as much as you can ask for in a Thai restaurant.    All of their locations are pleasantly decorated, but the Village Square branch is bigger and more modern in its setting.  I find Thai restaurants to have generally pleasant service overall, but I think Archi's goes even a step beyond that.  Their food is at least good, with some great dishes.  I'm partial to the Thai Toast, a must have appetizer in my book.  It's a flavorful meat "stuffed" onto toast slices, served with cucumber & onion salad.  LOVE this dish.  Their papaya salad and beef salad are also very good.  For main dishes, I like all their curry dishes and the spicy basil dish, and you can't go wrong with their pad thai.  Unless you find that spectacular Thai place, this is the place where you will not be disappointed and can find some great surprises.  There's a reason why this chain is so popular and continues to expand.  Table-for-1 Factor:  I went to lunch at the Flamingo location and there were several people eating alone.  So it's at least good for lunch, and I think it will be okay for dinner as well.  Atmosphere isn't intimidating so I don't think it will feel too awkward.

3qRDnewZazt2LgI8785JDQ.text: After talking about different places to eat for Thai food from people residing in Las Vegas, I have often heard I must try Archi's!  "It's the best there is!"  Well I like to rephrase that, "It's the best there is if your not familiar with Authentic Thai food and enjoy Americanized Thai Food."  Brutal comment, but it's the truth.  When I arrived to pick up my food, not a single Asian in sight in the restaurant, except for the workers there of course!  I was a bit worried about that, but as I took my first bite of the Thai Beef Salad, I was pretty impressed with the flavors!  It was sweet, savory, and a hint of spice.  Pretty much the type of flavor expected in a Thai style salad.  What I was disappointed in was their Phad Thai!  Now EVERYONE has said their Phad Thai was the best, well I must say, i have had better!  The rice noodles were cooked well, but the type of ingredients used wasn't as tasteful, kind of reminded me of Chinese Sa Tay sauce on rice noodles, which was not what I was expecting.    I asked my friend who's family is from Thailand about her experience there and she basically said, "It's good, if you like Americanized Thai Food."  I responded, well sometimes I do crave it but I prefer the traditional Authentic That food I can get closer to home.    I mean come on, what kind of Authentic Thai food serves an egg roll and crispy won ton skin with their Phad Thai?  How unoriginal and American is that!?    Although I did rate this place a 3-Star, I'd still come back here for their yummy Thai Beef Salad!  Yum!

12OZdM6EALxBUN4dKgpoxA.text: Went there for lunch today. Their lunch specials were very bland. The service was not great either. When we  asked the waitress why they didn't make our meal spicy she said that she had assumed we didn't want it spicy (?)   Very disappointed.

I4V7chf71x0-sG2YgdsRCA.text: We love Archie's.  Why? 1)  Delicious pad thai, and pad woon sen. 2) Huge portions at reasonable price. 3) Great atmosphere. this is like an oasis in the Mojave desert.

q2OUux_wX5h_llSpmL-1Uw.text: Best place to go eat Thai food in vegas. I've been going to them for more than 6 years and there quality has never deteriorated. Try their pad Thai or Fried Rice with Chicken.

44C5A93PetpuzNs7mjnVBg.text: Best Thai food in town!!!! Friendly staff, reasonable prices! Thai tea is amazing! Panang curry is amazing!!! This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas!!!

EPWnsJyVuJir8jslCOXJ-Q.text: This place is the best!  Pineapple fried rice. Pineapple curry. Coconut ice cream.  Amazing. :)  Drive through window. Awesome price. I always buy an extra order of rice because there is enough curry to last for days.

0IqwsL0y0SKxzt2Khelh6w.text: So it gets 4 stars just for the drive through.  Perfect when the flu bug hit and ya need soup to take home as it pairs so well with trash tv.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drive through thai!!

dbcgjRUXqzOkhjDzGUSzXw.text: My favorite Thai place in town. Even when I travel I have yet to find better Thai food. The employees are great & the food is fresh! We get a beef salad every time we go! Everything from the curry to pad Thai to sticky rice dessert. It's all amazing! I even go with my BF who grew up with a Thai mother & this is his favorite place to go as well (:

JGNmSPAUzKRwIxU689x9YA.text: Authentic and spicy, Good service. Pad thai and tom yum are a must try!

BuRvdprLypATmR5iWj8rZQ.text: Great food. One of the best Thi places in Vegas.  Highly recommended . Been here few times and each time been great

jVDNAW7Kuy1DNK8EJsTeIw.text: This place has fed me more times than my parents fed me growing up. I LOVE THEM! Best pad thai in Vegas. And the drive-thru order pick up is amazing!

X6kfLeUnmuPi29zYwG4zgA.text: First time eating Thai food in Las Vegas.  I'd say its pretty good!  I came because of its rating on yelp and its worth it.  Quick and courteous service.  Favorite dishes, so far, (because we'll be back) papaya salad, and the seafood fried rice. Both should be a spicy level 3. We  got the 5 and it was too spicy. Curry chicken seemed salty and watered down. Stuffed chicken didn't seem fresh.  Both chicken dishes weren't bad.   No matter what, I can't wait to try this place out again!

44DpLJN2k6Q-fRcAHOM2vw.text: First time there and it was awesome!! It's now my favorite place for Thai. My boyfriend and I went, we ordered the Pad Kea Mow with chicken and everything was perfect about it! The flavors were superb! We also ordered the beef salad and omg! Best thing I have ever tasted! It has a top notch beef sirloin cooked tossed with greens, cucumbers, onions and a very tasty sauce. Sounds crazy, but we were amazed at how excellent it tasted! It's a must try! The service was extordinary, so friendly and caring! We will definitely being going back and recommending our friends and family to this place!

FbTvCoAjV42MlKZYr3fFIw.text: Food was delicious. The tofu here is WAY WAY better than the tofu at Komol. Plump vs. hard, dry, & shriveled. The flavors are definitely there, too.  Best part is that they're vegan friendly and willing to omit the fish sauce/shrimp paste.  Another special thing about this place is that they offer whole, fresh coconut to drink and eat! Now that's hard to find. It was delicious, but REALLY filled me up. A coconut with all its water and meat can be a meal in itself. I suggest sharing it with another person if you're getting it for dessert.

0r7HRuGiS9UIGcaSIY7ZVg.text: Food is good But services is shit Onwer is changed? employees very unkindly and something is different then before. . (About atmospheres not interiors)

Tq5Axys4iTZCqPSJe07srw.text: These guys have the best Thai food. We tried all their plates when we were living in Las Vegas trying to find something we dislike, but it never happened. This is a must try!!

nhlQk1PDiVmjWiYK1mA0-w.text: Damn good.  Yes its in the middle of nowhere, far west of the Strip, but worth it.  Small place but cozy.  Pad Thai with pork was great.  The pork wasn't just ground up and mixed in but sliced and cooked separately so it was tender and flavorful.  Also had the coconut curry catfish which was amazing.

6870YQCnI5Jf7jElhP9FIw.text: Favorite Thai Restaurant in Las Vegas! Can't get enough of their pad thai and panang curry!

NOT_ZZVcz3AFrgLLQix5Yg.text: Good food, crowded, service somewhat spotty, cheap prices. I would totally go again.

gfllPV2WSRjAxSdbxkFg9w.text: Get a waitress that understands English. We order pineapple fried rice for my wife cos she can't take spicy food. And I ordered beef panang for myself. When she asked how hot, I said medium. Soon, the pineapple fried rice came, and my wife was shocked at cos it's too spicy for her. We thought Pineapple fried rice is spicy. We waited for my Panang and after 20 minutes, no panang . When we asked, the waitress said, you folks only ordered pineapple fried rice, medium hot. WTF! No wonder we were spiced with chili in the pineapple fried rice and my wife wasn't happy at all. I m writing this from the restaurant. It's alright ..... Mai pen rai attitude...gave us the bill.. And send us packing. This place sucks even before they can serve the food. If they can't take the correct orders, I wonder how can they serve..... I give it thumbs down. Wont be back...for sure.

G2GsdyGF1rZsJ_VYDWjgKg.text: I'm really picky about Thai food since we go to some good places in the Bay Area.  But Archi's Thai is just as good as our favorite Thai place in the Bay.  The crab fried rice was YUMMY and the pad see ew was really good too.  It was nice alternative than eating on the strip and they have a drive thru too.  It was reasonable priced and I'm sure we would go again the next time we are in Vegas and we have a car.

3mlXlAYl12BrGV77QFxZFw.text: Food, service and ambiance. This place will give any Thai restaurant a run for its money. This nice little restaurant is tucked away in a small shopping center near Flamingo and Jones. The restaurant itself is small but the decor is nice and neat. We had the  panang shrimp, beef pad see ew and catfish delight. The food was so tasty and flavorful that we did not have any leftovers. What a great place. If you have never been to Archis...you need to go soon!!!!!!

gvDAananohL9kVddXVGuRw.text: We went there during last year December, first we found this restaurant in Las Vegas because of Yelp's reviews, so we gave it a try.  We went there during lunch hour, and there were so many to go order. Services is excellent even they were so busy during lunch hour. We order Shrimp cake, Pai Thai, and Red Curry Rice, the food quality are excellent ! That's surprise me, I always thought Los Angeles's thai food are good, now I change my mind !

AdQ7TKL2BzI6GQzhbDiFZA.text: AMAZING.  I've been in Vegas now for about a year and a half and this is hands-down the best Thai in the city!   The building is so-so, but really, it's all about the food --- and they do it well.

p3yCeDQ4qOkVwQQ7AA2K9A.text: Im not that familiar with Thai food...but..... Yummy~! Good lunch specials~! i had the chicken basil... and the beef salad! I was even craving it the day after!!!

LBhJGG9AKnwp3DDOY_Ta1Q.text: Every time I visit my brother in law, I demand we go here at least once! The thai iced tea is amazing, and my favorite dish is Ginger Chicken! So good!

r_8QHOlIfBdR-CabP5-emg.text: Fantastic food and environment in dodgy looking building. And I am very hard to please when it comes to Thai food.

7jKnKC4noC-elZCDbw6MHA.text: We were desperate for affordable, tasty food in LA.  Archi's got the job done.  This place has solid, vegetarian-friendly Thai fare in a city that doesn't necessarily pride itself on good cheap eats.  And the Thai iced teas are mammoth...

FLboIwfB2hHjUB5iEPxg4Q.text: Stopped here while in Las Vegas for a trade show. The service was good, the place was clean with nice lighting, and most of the tables were full. Had the green curry and spring rolls. Food was great - I made sure to order mild after reading the reviews on here. The sticky rice wasn't exactly right - it was more like steamed rice - but it was still tasty. I agree with many other reviewers that this place is more Thai-American than purely Thai. But that's not a bad thing - the food was delicious, fresh, and fast. I definitely recommend Archi's Thai Kitchen.

U9wMAMKJYukg5GbdB08Qcg.text: Off the strip and well worth the drive or cab. Less than half the price than anything on the strip and way better. Tried the pad thai, Tom kha and egg rolls and everything was absolutely perfect. The best!

FS7reH5flXu0c5A6G8D2eg.text: We went to this place during our vacation last week and were very impressed. We eat a decent amount of thai food, and this place stood up with the better ones. It's off-strip and is very casual (which we prefer). We had:  - some curry / red bell pepper / catfish thing. fantastic. #12 or #13, i forget. - green chicken curry - very good - wonton soup - very good. nice mild broth flavor, and the meat/wontons were good.  Service was good not great.  I'll be coming back here when i come back to vegas.

R0-yEavI3YF7E2_AOFHSOw.text: From the time I moved to Vegas, I've been hearing about this Lotus of Siam rival. My man and I were searching for a different place to go and decided on Archi's since we were not far away. Not sure how they did it, but these folks nailed the "cozy living room." Most tables are part booth, part chair, but all of them are comfortable and the lighting really adds to this resto's intimacy. Determined not to get our Thai standards, we opted for the silver noodles salad (sans chicken) -- which was an absolute stand-out, and the curry fried rice with crab meat (salivation central!!) Not so great were the seafood omelet (though the sauce that came w/ was delish!) and the eggplant with shrimp dish (while everything was properly cooked, the dish was super-duper bland -- my man and I were brainstorming things to add to spice this bad boy up!) Will I come back again? Absolutely!! Love this resto's ambiance and that they're mixing it up by offering folks more menu options than what the average thai place offers. Service is fantastic, with folks constantly checking up to make sure you're enjoying your meal.  Final plus: they stick to their guns on the spice level factor.  If you order a 5 of 10 on the spicy scale, expect to get exactly that!

OS24qgH-Y9epXTq0HkUpxg.text: Hill'z yeah!  VERY excellent Thai for great prices. I spent a month in Bangkok and ate at some fantastic hole in the wall places there and Archi's comes close. It's not as good as the amazing Lotus of Siam but it comes close enough.  Cheap prices, great service, excellent food!  Hey, I want Archi's to do well, but I'm pretty happy with the lack of wait at the Rainbow location. On second thought, plenty of room, so you should all come!  Tom Yum Goong, Chicken Pad Kapow (ORDER THIS!!!), Pad See Ew (OMG GET IT!)...  Go with a big group... order it all! It's great and great quality.

BZ3Q_duwNK-EDadILiYATQ.text: My husband and I just had dinner, and I did Not leave happy. we are In Vegas for 4 night and thought we would try this place out because of the reviews from yelp, what a mistake! We ordered 4 dishes and the portions were small and two of the dishes were very sour, they were the Tom yum soup with shrimp and pad Thai with shrimp. I ate it because we were hungry, from a long day of swimming. I am from la and I've had good Thai food, this place was not! We spent $40.00, it was totally not worth it. I would of been happier eating at Thai BBQ in down town.

7dQwLKLu6U2IxmOuV7z2IQ.text: Archie's opened a third location! It is located in the Village Square at Sahra and Ft. Apache. As usual, great food! The owner cooked it himself!  I can't believe kayla's comments. She's obviously isn't famaliar with Thai food to say Archie's food is "un-Thai." As a matter of fact, the curry is made from scratch, not from a paste. I had a Thai maid when I lived in Asia and I KNOW WHAT REAL THAI FOOD tastes like and THIS IS IT!

_hMnv4lS6ZNMQJ_FY3Lw0w.text: TheirbThai tea is super good! However their combination red curry was not so good. The meat was very small and dry. The shrimp was super tiny and tasted weird. Would not recommend their curry at all.

esRfDyTgwlX0hA8l4A6Xxg.text: They took ten minutes to come to my table but sat other race specific individuals and greeted them as soon as they sat.

Ud4dlvZfTIelSrih9B0HkQ.text: I've been going to Archi's for a long time now and I think I've had most of the items on the menu. But, the Spicy Basil Chicken dish is the best. I tried it today and I actually finished the whole thing even though their portions are huge. I will definitely try that again next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hgM7vlDS06HHA3jgwWP8Rw.text: One of my favorite place to eat absolutely delicious and the service are excellent thank you thank you thank you for the Yen Ta for. I love that dish see you guys later:) Thank you

-C1N0CpwrCss-D7Q5aoSPQ.text: Everybody loves this location. I don't mind it much, they have this makeshift drive-thru window. The staff is very, very inexperienced, but it could just be the day I went is when everybody's kids were scheduled to work I don't know. Spice 2 of 10 is spicy enough for me here. Typical selection of dishes, nice rice-based desserts if that's what you like. This is apparently the first Archi's there ever was. That counts for something.

SSaqZRuOe11Y3erj88vlxQ.text: Went there for an early lunch on a Saturday. In fact our party of 4 was there 5 min after opening.  Today's meal was disappointing - hence the only three stars. I usually enjoy the Pai Tai and ordered again today. Today the taste was off - way off. This gave me the feeling that I was getting yesterday's left overs warmed up.  The taste was bland, like really bland.  Usually they have some very enjoyable tastes. New chef?? Hungover chef? Help me here - I've always had a good meal until today.  Our soup was tasty as always.  My biggest complaint here is that most times they bring everything at near the same time; spring roll, soup, and entree. I really would like to space it out a bit especially when the restaurant is not busy.  Not sure when I will return. The last visit left a bad tast in my mouth - literally.  I think time to find another TAI place or go again after they have been open awhile.

mzxVfFTghqUoc9uIdOBo2A.text: Honestly I have to be treated pretty poorly to write a review. In fact I have never written a bad review...until now!  Tonight after an hour we stopped our waiter to find out why all the tables around us even with larger parties were eating their meals he said to us "Oh I was going to come talk with you. We lost your order ticket." It took an hour?  And all the newcomers were eating??  We were a party of two at the 1st table. Wish I could review the food but we left. So I'll review the meals we have eaten at Archi's on Sahara. They were wonderful. Flamingo get your act together.

ZhNeENSz251b3fybYbCmMA.text: My boyfriend actually introduced this place to me almost ten years ago. We were so frequent here that my boyfriend's dad knew Archie! For a good four years we would eat here at a constant rate because they served great portions for inviting the whole family. We'd order 5 dishes, easy.   Well now, it's like the recession for Archie's  So disappointed in this place. They have switched up their to-go boxes for much smaller boxes (over 1/2 size reduction of the original boxes) but haven't reduced the price!   Then a couple months ago, I saw that the Fort Apache location was on "DIRTY DINING." This explained my friend's and my severe uncontrollable lava experience nearly ten minutes after we paid the bill. I vowed never to eat at that location again.   This has been a long time coming, and this does come with a heavy heart. Boycotting Archie's. Komol (sp?) Is worth the drive now.

YhunfBLpQ-C4YordzwST4g.text: I've seen this location for years (since the 1990s) and noticed it even more because it has a drive-through window. It still being here, after all those years, really makes a statement (and it's understandable that it's loved by other Yelp reviewers).   This is bigger than a hole in a wall, so I will call this cozy (kind of reminded me of a relative's living room). Hubby thought it was tiny. So, anyway, for a weeknight it was pretty steady, looked like there were a couple empty tables. Also, had takeout business too. No place for waiting customers except to stand there. The entrance door is pretty much the middle of the restaurant, which is also where the counter is situated. Hubby said that there was more seating out of view, near the bathrooms. Music was playing but it wasn't loud, you could still hold a conversation.    We've been to another location (W. Sahara- elegant ambiance, almost feels like you're at a resort) and love the food. I thought the quality of the food was equally very good and yummy-tasting. We had a chicken curry dish (the potatoes were tender, the curry had a good flavor), fried rice (cooked perfectly), and dessert (mmm, this was a treat, not a weeknight sort of thing). We were celebrating later than usual for dinner, on a weeknight. This would be our new side of town. So, yes, we will be back soon. I think I have a takeout menu.     Service was very good. The server was nice and attentive. Very clean.

nr5tXWe4ct6rykjbFC6FzA.text: I absolutely love Thai food, however my partner isin't really fond of it, until we came to this delightful joint. The seating is nice, ambience is great, both during lunch and dinner. The staff are forthcoming and welcoming. As someone who lives for spicy food (I usually order 9-10) sometimes I want more, and they give this pounded chilli which does just the trick and I'm glad they have it here. As for the food, one of the more authentic places you will find in Las Vegas. Great quality, fresh and not greasy as you would find at other restaurants. Price point: outstanding for the quality. My partner said he changed his mind about Thai food after coming here so that should speak volumes. Would recommend the basil meat dish, pad woon sen and mango sticky rice. Definitely looking forward to coming down here to try the rest of the menu. Keep it up!

LomfSNQtKIRht-5hcfqVhg.text: Best Thai food in Las Vegas hands down. That is including the big shot named places as well. Reasonably priced and always great, very consistent. I eat here once a week or more. Whole menu is great. A good delivery option too as Thai food travels well.

ncuojFeyVq97ZGmi_q61JQ.text: I have been going to Archi's for at least 11 years. I am NEVER disappointed. Everyone I have brought here remains a loyal customer. The staff is friendly. The food is flavorful and incredible. I have never had a bad meal at any of their locations. Archi's is my home for delicious Thai food. From the egg rolls, stuffed chicken wings, Tom Kha soup,  masaman, spicy basil, and pad Thai... You can't go wrong. I will be a loyal customer as long as they are in operation.

sixZIjngThrt4qKrRX3_Mg.text: I've been eating at Archi's for years. We went to the Flamingo location for lunch the other day. I like to order food that is cooked to order. I don't trust food that's been sitting in a steam table. So my veggies were very undercooked, the chicken was over cooked and dry. I should have sent it back, it was not up to their previous standards. They weren't busy so it was a surprise. I guess I should have realized something was different, the restaurant was 2/3 empty at lunch time. Come on Archi's, up your game.

Li8Kx2N62v4uDQ1MZ_C_ZQ.text: First time to try this location. Service was a little slower them the other location, but the food tasted great and the spice level was perfect at a number 7. I had the spicy basil with pork. This dish is so filling and probably should be split between 2 for lunch but hey, I'm a big boy!!  This place was pretty packed for lunch but still worth the wait if you have some extra time on your lunch hour.

rwUkZGpra36TRuQt3moeMw.text: I finally had the chance to check out Archi's for a lunch date. I could kick myself for missing out all of this time. I live not far from this small yet cute and cozy Thai restaurant and have passed by it every day. The menu is full of many good looking options and we tried the lunch special shrimp pad thai and sweet and sour shrimp. The service is friendly and the food is delicious. Mmmmm yum yes I want some more! Thai me up please!

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and sour shrimp and shrimp pad thai lunch special

SdkS-4Tndlm2QPPnN5pGTw.text: Very poor service! We had to wait for the order very long time! It was not busy either! But nobody came to our table! And they served everything together, drinks, soup, and food! And also it took about more than 35min! Seriously???? Never go back this location!!

cz7lOG_2oNbYUOF2-9BOlQ.text: Archi, We having been going to your W Flamingo location for years.  We were there last night and here's what happened:  The crispy egg rolls were cold inside so we sent them back.  The food runner practically throws the food down and runs away...very rude.  My husband's dish arrived at least five minutes before mine.  When we were half way through our meal, the egg rolls landed on our table, but this time they were to greasy and uneatable.  Absolutely no warmth or personality in the restaurant.  Not enough help.  Tables dirty, people waiting forever to get seated and get their meal.  There were tons of open tables.  Just a really bad experience and we won't be going back.  Also, it was clear that we didn't eat another bite of the egg rolls, and the server didn't even ask why.

Rwja9xMveLJg78CmYiCIHQ.text: Three weeks ago I picked up our usual order and spent about $50 which we do several times a month but I was sick with my asthma and bronchitis. I had ordered the shrimp coconut curry soup with rice, for myself,  my favorite but when I got home There was only four shrimp's in the soup.  This dish usually lasts me two meals. I was disappointed that there was only two shrimp per serving for the two days, I was sick while eating this special soup that helps me feel better.I went to place a new order for my family and was in your drive up window your flamingo location and told them what had happened to this dish and the first two young man said not a problem we will give you three extra shrimp because I said either you could give me a discount off my order but they offered three extra shrimp. I said fine. Then another guy came to the window and started accusing me of lying insisting that the cook always puts seven shrimp in the soup.  He said I should've come back and show them that there was only 4 shrimp. I told him I've been sick and are you accusing me of lying he was insistent they would not give me the three extra shrimp so I canceled my $50 order of food for my family that night and drove away.  This guys name was and I apologize if I get it incorrect  BD? I am very upset with how I was treated. I understand people can be dishonest but I've never put in a complaint before or have a history of this other than what I had just said and for this man to treat me this way is not the right way to do business I hope you can make this right with me and my family. I have left an email to owner but they don't care. Terrible customer service to people! Plus on another occasion the noodles in a dish cause chest pains which they apologize and make good on cause the cook put the wrong ones in.

aPYDtq_mfDKcyrq6R63m-w.text: Awesome service! Edward was my server, my compliments to him. Very polite, I cannot have a complain. The food was amazing, I had the pad Thai, steamed rice and egg rolls.

G3PjcwVBm8UJ1cg1fEQZhQ.text: I've always loved it here!! I always get the Beef Salad and it's a perfect serving. The Thai tea is huge and I usually have to take it home. Cute little place, clean, and they also have a drive thru which is really great for Thai food on the go. Definitely coming back!

8JtZTSKpdE5OVjJxe8Cufw.text: Give it a 4 star solid stuff, second or third best in town.  Best in sw. Mmmmmm.  Mmmmm good.

LLk1MDaAnmdvWpBh5TV5IA.text: A HIDDEN GEM in the Vegas desert!!!!!  This place is excellent. The food was great. Service top notch and friendly!  We have eaten in many Thai restaurants and this one is most likely the very best we ate in.  Zagat rated four years in a row and many other countless awards this place has accumulated including a Michelin award.  With that fact in mind, we are in for a treat.  We ordered Garlic Pepper Beef and Ginger Ginger Ginger Chicken.  Both plates were FLAVORFUL and DELICIOUS.  I think the word I was looking for is UMAMI !!!!!  This one, is a must stop for anyone that is craving for Thai food.  It is very authentic and prepared by Thai cooks.  EXCELLENT prices as well and definitely worth the wait when food is being prepared.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  Keep up the GREAT job!!!!!  Food     =     A+ Staff      =     A+ Decor   =     B+

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger Ginger Chicken
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Pepper Beef
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ItuTqoUkXYfBr-TrxaHF7w.text: I only tried the mango sticky rice and its AMAZING! Try it! The drive through is a wait they take a while to get to the window

GaqjOtaD8sm9slSuZrN3_g.text: The sad thing is I'm a big fan of Archi's and promote them to everyone.  I always bragged they were the best and loved their Pad Thai.  I finally convinced three of my coworkers to have lunch there, even though it was out of the way on August 31 after a big meeting.,  I was going to finally show them the best Thai in town.  I don't know what happened.  The Pad Thai was blah and had no taste. We had to add a bunch of spice sauce just to give it taste. I was embarrassed, they looked at me like "really - this is it?".  Maybe they had someone new cooking, or they forgot some much needed ingredients.  I hope they get their mojo back.

RxwibWJSUSbL8xqI05dTzg.text: Took 45 min to get 2 veggie dishes. They told me "they are packing it up" for 20 min when I asked for my money back they finally had the order ready. It was average. Too oily and way to spicy for the number I ordered. Used to be a good place needs better staff

lzPrA9VxDiWBb2CT44TtWw.text: Great service rather you dine in or take to go. People that work here are always smiling and even when they are busy they seem to enjoy their job. Did I mention the food is amazing!? Can't say I have had one bad thing here. Crab Fried rice, Mongolian, Yellow chicken curry! All amazing.

Wzh1oOwf5681keqbOVBl-g.text: Archi's is the next best thing to Lotus of Siam in Vegas. It is closer to my place, and it's VERY good! Their curry & catfish are my fave and I love them spicy! If you want authentic Thai food, go to Archi's!

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ka pao
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OriFvDF9dvYt1RuleKCneA.text: This place is great as far as quality of food and value all rolled up into one. We went w/ the green curry (the only thing my wife seems to order any Thai restaurant we go to) and I got the beef pad kee maw.  Throw in a big thai iced tea and the whole thing came to just a a few cents over $20.    This definitely would've been more at Krung Thai and Thai Spice so you simply can't beat the bangness for the buckness.

kl9YQLg8F6Glx3A_33q7sw.text: This is my standard now for Thai food.  The curry is great but the Pad Thai CANNOT BE BEAT.  They even have drive thru window at their Flamingo location only.

hG1hH4U8RWRnyV2AS7rcRw.text: I'm really not going to delve into the authenticity of this place with my review. I'm not Thai, I don't know how to cook Thai food.. I'm really no expert. That being said...  We went for lunch today and I was blown away by the food. We were the only patrons when we arrived at 11:20. By the time we left at noon, it was packed. Arrive early my friends!   Lunch specials are a reasonable $6.95. I've never seen a Thai place with lunch specials, but clearly I've lived a sheltered existence.   Chicken pad thai - I guess they make it the "Americanized" way, but I don't care.. it was so damn tasty. The portion is quite large for a lunch portion (approx 2 cups?). I couldn't finish half of it. I almost made myself sick trying to eat it all.. yup, I'm a fatty.  Beef with bell peppers - a much more modestly (read: appropriate!) sized entree. The beef was very high quality for an asian stir fry type beef and the bell peppers were tasty as well. While there's nothing special about this dish, it was of high quality and it seemed to be relatively low calorie if you're eating light. Served with white rice.  All lunch specials were served with a wonton (seemed to have meat in it? yumm), egg roll (just ok!), and soup of the day. The soup today was chicken coconut soup. I think the lady called it that because I'm not asian, because it tasted like Tom Kha Gai to me! A mini cup of Tom Kha Gai to wash down my pad thai with? I'm in heaven.   Service was fast, and like I said many times.. the food and ingredients were all top knotch. A pleasant surprise for $6.95 each! I'll definitely be hitting this place again.

_hChdoXTCInTbQyqmfhsmg.text: The pad Thai is amazing....the best...we got it with a heat of four and it was hot but still flavorful...the basil pork was okay but I wouldn't get it again...Pretty much Italian sausage with veges....stuffed eings were good too...

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed fried chicken wings are amazing...

2SxRJPQfT4JRmI6YWkM1rA.text: Every time I'm in Las Vegas I make a point to go to Archi,s for some of the best Thai food I've ever had! Believe me, I'm a foodie and I don't eat at crappy restaurants! The staff is very friendly & accommodating. Make sure to take care of your server, they have families to go home to and provide for as well!

Mfun4YE9zp5slBMJt0E_Dw.text: This place is worth visiting. One of my criteria when evaluating Chinese and Thai food is the freshness of the food, eg chicken.  It is a harbinger of what they do in the kitchen. Many places the chicken is stale. We ordered two dishes, one a stiry fry type chicken and the other a curry. The stir fry had very fresh chicken 5/5, the curry was a 4/5 in freshness. The overall quality of the food and taste was excellent, ambiance is home like, and the service is fine, but could be better.

6_JRYjldcAPtSrfXPsvX8w.text: Good service, authentic food & quite environment :) we ordered crab fire rice, seafood green curry & pad Thai they are very yummy!

olT76eMQA0VWSJMv7Wi6tQ.text: I have to say... I always rank food at ethnic restaurants based on the simplest thing they make. I ordered Pad Thai, which is a good standard at a Thai place. Hands down, BEST PAD THAI. It's the best I've had. EVER. We're had Tom Ka soup to start. I read on some review that it was bland. Www decided that we'd try anyway. Not mad we did. It was great. Super full of flavor My husband had Pad Ke Mow. AMAZING. BEST HE'S HAD. The service was awesome. Not overbearing but they came around enough that were didn't feel ignored. Prices were great. Servings were big. I'm a big girl. I can eat anyone under the table. It's True. However, i brought home leftovers.

sFXI8LLUI3XW-NjY5axQMQ.text: Please stop the nonsense of soda in a can so you can recharge me $1.95 of half a glass of Diet Coke. Nothing worse than a great meal and then you feel ripped off on freaking SODA!! Get with the program and buy a soda dispenser and have free refills LIKE THE REST OF THE CITY!

6UiZI-r6ND9ezIiz9n7LLA.text: Love this place. My fiance loves the spicy basil beef and I love the shrimp and broccoli. Their soups are very good as well. Great service, great food. Definitely give it a try

JniPGS9VESVZfX-fYSX96w.text: Friend and I ate here for dinner in June 2012 after an intense game of ultimate frisbee so we were pretty hungry.  I had the $10 pad thai which was okay and my friend had something which he said was ok.  The portion sizes were huge as neither of us could finish our respective dish.    If I had gone to Archi's for a lunch special I'd rate them 4-stars as the food's fine, restaurant decor nice and service friendly.  Otherwise I'd say they're average for a Vegas Thai eatery.

HFfdT2_pji82wAy2r5bLTQ.text: My husband used to be in Vegas for work pretty frequently and he loved this place so when we stayed at the palms this weekend we had to stop by (it's probably less than 2 miles down the road). We split the wontons and the red curry for lunch and it was plenty of food for both of us.  The curry had great flavor without being too spicy ( I don't like things super spicy so we ordered it as a 2 out of 10).

eWVPI3eeOQ6ZNlLjVmfd9Q.text: Best panang curry in town. Service is excellent although the younger employees' English is iffy. Great take out as well.

cn0eK-bYEKRi-3haZ8heoA.text: This is a standard for all of our trips to Vegas.  The food is generally authentic Thai and it's a reasonably priced meal off the strip without the hustle-and-bustle.  I always get the spicy basil and beef, and it never disappoints.  The red curry is almost always solid; you can wash it down with a Singha beer; and the service is always warm and friendly

zVUXO9EqiY-lbgolEXzs-Q.text: This is the first Thai restaurant I tried in Las Vegas and I have been going back since. To me the original W. Flamingo location is the best if even only for nostalgic purposes but it is very small and only seats around 20 people. The other two locations are much bigger and more comfortable but something about the food is just not as good.   I love getting the Tom Kha soup and mint chicken! Im getting really hungry just typing about it! The lack of 5 stars is due to the inconsistent spicy rating system. Some times I order a spicy #5 and its fairly bland and other times it burns a hole in my esophagus. But other than that the food has always done a spectacular job of quenching my Thai food cravings.

27idATcuM_AEIiEurg2QZA.text: DO NOT TELL MY MOM!!  The pad thai served here is *sometimes* better than hers.. The only thing that this place is lacking in when I come is service. Asian mothers ruin dining for their children- I always need extra lime for my pad thai, but after waiting 15 minutes for the lime I asked for I started eating my almost lukewarm noodles, sans lime.   I like that their lunch options come with sides. I remember the soup being pretty good, and the spring rolls being pretty generic. Nothing to write home about.   Has anyone tried the '10' level spiciness on their entree? I'm always scared to get it, thinking that once they see the ticket in the kitchen they're going to think I'm some sort of badass and scoop 2 more spoonfuls of chili into my pad thai, so I get the 9 and it's pleasantly spicy for me.

XMsly_NJkWwMO6RbwuO9yg.text: A delicious Las Vegas staple for excellent Thai food and service. The original location on flamingo is still the best and the lunch special can not be beat.

C8wfAYnwDHq_dRz3d4wZDg.text: Good little Thai spot. Fresh Coconuts, Pad Thai, Tom Yum... they got it all and its all pretty good.

dtA0VWJFyNsgzNytpF8ySg.text: i had the lunch special pad thai chicken i was undecided between that and pad thai shrimp the rice noodles where stuck together as if they had beeen using the same noodles all morning. I got my food for take out and lets just say im not a pan i will continue to go to thai noodle house YUCK. eggrolls were good though

HMH-OK_1xC833CSeECZZvA.text: This isn't a very fancy restaurant, but it's a nice atmosphere if you want to come with friends and have a decent meal.  I had the Cashew Nut with tofu, spicy level 7 (on a scale of 1-10).  There weren't many customers in the restaurant, so my food came very quickly, probably in less than five minutes.  The portions were of a decent size, but they were a little too liberal with the onion.  The whole dish was basically covered in onion.  It's like they chopped up an entire onion and put it on my food.  I didn't mind because I'm fine with onions, but for most people it might be a little much.    The wait staff was very friendly.  I'm not a very bossy person so they don't really have to do much for me.    Overall, a decent meal, decent portions, at a good price.

v6cNBg-UcJJZYBilLkgagQ.text: Love this place best Thai food I've had in town!! Great service recommend to all!! But don't believe me you must come try it yourself.

tP7rwUV2Ou7nhUvNDCeoOQ.text: My brother, sister, her boyfriend, and I came here after finding out that Lotus of Siam was closed for the day.  We still had a craving for Thai food and ended up here.  It's been years since I've eaten here! One thing that I love about this place is that you get a gigantic glass of thai tea with just the right amount of ice and mixture of tea and cream.  Most other places will give you a regular sized glass and fill it up with ice and it's finished before your food even comes.  This gigantic glass lasts throughout the whole meal and then some!  We ordered chicken larb (medium spicy) with a side of sticky rice, papaya salad, chicken pad thai, and chicken pad see ew. The entrees came with steamed rice and we didn't have to order it separately. The food altogether was yum. They had asked how spicy we wanted the larb, but they didn't ask for the papaya salad.  I feel like they made the papaya salad medium and the larb mild when I had wanted the larb to be medium.  The larb was ok, although I've had better larb at other Thai restaurants.    I love the homey feel of this restaurant.  The way that it is set up makes you feel like you are sitting at home enjoying a home cooked meal.  The overall service was excellent and they even packed up our food at the end. The pricing was reasonable as well.  For our meal, including 3 thai teas and 1 thai iced coffee, the total came out to $75.

uHImU3TT6WomHALWPCIqMg.text: I visited Archie's restaurant on Flamingo and Jones. I just ordered a Thai coffee to go and asked The girl with braces (she did not have a name tag )to make it with easy ice.  I I paid for it and left and  shortly after I was surprised to  discover that the cup was full with ice. There was not even three quarters of the cup that weren't filled with ice. The drink is not cheap and I really don't want to pay for coffee and get ice. I even took a picture of it. Too bad I can't post that too I am disappointed.

Ez9zK0tfg87Qt5LYxQq1GQ.text: Always come here for thai, I trust their food's freshness and flavor. Service is good and I never have a problem ordering food on the phone  I always get their beef green curry, shrimp Tom yum or their shrimp fried rice. Next time I come in I'm going to try something different  till next time....

QQuoQLLVbx7EA4EC-NC3wQ.text: Our family is a huge fan of Pin Kaow.  We were going to try Prommares, but instead chose Archi's.    Food - I had the Tofu Pad Thai (spicy level 6) and Vegetable Fried Rice.  The Pad Thai was ok.  I wasn't blown away from it and wasn't left wanting more.  I asked the server to fry the Tofu crisp and it came out soft.  They should have fried it a little bit longer.  The spice level was appropriate and enjoyable.  I felt the same way about the Fried Rice.  It was just ok.  Atmosphere - The restaurant is small and the tables kind of feel on top of each other.  We prefer a more private dining experience.  We had a party of 6 people and that is probably the most I'd try to take here.  There is enough room to get larger groups in there, but it wouldn't feel comfortable in my opinion.  Service - The service was good.  The servers were friendly.  Will I return?  Probably not.....unless I'm invited there by a friend or family member.
