Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q9tPId3XXJKEgy4iYll7kw.text: Went in on a Saturday night for an early Mother's Day dinner. I had heard wonderful things about this place so we decided to try it out! We ordered pad Thai which was delicious and a hearty serving, Mongolian beef (Mongolian sauce over beef with opinions, bell peppers, mushrooms and carrots although it had more veggies then beef) but had an over all good flavor and tenderness and last we ordered spicy basil chicken (ground chicken with zucchini bell peppers and basil)which had excellent flavor. Our entrees were ordered at a spicy level 7 which had spice but wasn't overly spicy.brhe restaurant was small and quiet and we had a 2 yr old toddler so next time we will be ordering take out unless it's a date night!  Loved the food here we will definitely be eating this again!!!

e4UQiCtgvvdeIcluA5OXAw.text: Every time I come here the food is delicious.  Chicken Pati and red curry are pretty good.

X7RWuEjw8V36Biq8Qg2gvg.text: Love this place! So good! Nom Nom Nom!!! Love the amount of veggie friendly options they offer!

MIeEh9mrujoke6Pc7Q812w.text: My favorite thai restaurant in Las Vegas! Man their thai tea is amazing! I've never had a dish I didn't like. Their staff is very friendly and attentive. I'll be back again and again.

XJizNFJcX8JdhqfuyeSOfw.text: I love this place but I wish they picked up the phone to do Togo orders more often . Ahh I call all the time . Sad face .

8qQb4_A_BoCxS5mF6Zc-nw.text: This place never fails. I've checked out many Thai places around Vegas and I aways seem to come back to this place. I always get the papaya salad, chicken satay, panang curry, and most importantly, their GARLIC PEPPER CHICKEN! This dish is life changing!!!

cmEXFUzLtfFdixq-myH4jA.text: Haven't tried Las Vegas's Thai selection, so I thought, TODAY IS THE DAY! I've been recommended two places, Pin Kaow and Archi's. Since Archi's was closer to me I decided to go with that.    The restaurant itself looked like a house that was remodeled into a restaurant. Cute and cozy. Looks like a nice place to have a lunch with some friends. I ordered the Pad Kee Mow and the Yellow Curry. I'm just going to assume that curries are already pre-made for the entire day and when ordered, they just heat it up for it to be ready to serve. And Pad Kee Mow's doesn't seem too difficult to whip up either. So why the long wait? I try to play in all possible reasons for the wait before I critique. Lots of people? Nope. Short staffed compared to the number of customers? Nope. I'm patient for the most part, especially if the food makes up for all of it! But sadly, it didn't.   The Yellow Curry was a little watered down to what I'm used to. The flavor was just not strong enough for me. I wouldn't say it was totally bland but, the curry itself was just not hitting those taste buds like I wanted it to. The Pad Kee Mow was..okay. I wished there was a stronger basil flavor and more noodles. You could tell all the vegetables that came with the dish were canned. Just didn't give off the high quality thai cuisine I had hoped for.   Better luck next time? I hope so!

ulevFVEmduJMPr5s8u58gg.text: It takes 20 minutes just to get something off the damned lunch menu. Left me NO time to sit down and enjoy it. Huge black mark in my book.

tECIcKZNS3AumbaJ_cSB0Q.text: This food is so good I would recommend it to my family and friends! There customer service is pretty good here always checking on us if we're ok and also they always refill our waters once we are finished.

ptWmKiGAMQ9EGKRpCLKa0A.text: I wanted to get food to bring home to my friends after work so I tried to call ahead several times and their phone rings and no one answers. So I went in person, let the gentlemen know I wanted to place an order to go, and he sat us at a table (???) to look at the menu while he helped other people for over 15 minutes.   I understand that to have a fast to go experience, I should call ahead. But that's not possible if they don't answer the phone. Very annoying. Won't be coming back.

rd2e37NvMEOEQdfYX8CXWQ.text: Stopped in for lunch today at this location since the one on Rainbow is currently closed for repairs.  I overheard one of the employees saying they were expanding the restaurant.  Hubby & I both enjoyed the Pad Thai lunch special.  It came w/ a cup of soup, a kickass egg roll w/ a lil heat & salad w/ a super yummy dressing.  Very generous portion size on the Pad Thai.  I picked chicken & hubby picked shrimp, both were excellent.  Service was stellar.  I loved everything, down to the crushed ice in my deliciously tropical flavored iced tea.  2 lunch specials w/ iced teas came to a whopping $28, NICE!

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3IoC0J0m2s1VBJ64zlbO-Q.text: Highly recommend! My Thai girlfriend brought us here & ordered many fabulous dishes in her native Thai language.  If she likes it even over the other 3 restaurants they own, you *know* this is good.  We left there completely stuffed and pleasantly happy.  You won't be disappointed.

u86LXCe0aqXwowoAWBnncw.text: The food was excellent. We tried Basil fried rice one with beef and one with chicken. Both were amazing with a lot of meat and vegetables. Loved it.

8tipepKkPysfAlMnBpK-lw.text: TERRIBLE FOOD!! They claim to serve "100% authentic thai" (but anyone who's actually HAD authentic thai) knows there's a BIG difference between those that put pride into their food vs places like these   1) The plates they gave us were filthy. 2) The egg rolls were cold. 3) They don't have coconut milk for thai tea, yet they have it for soup??? Ridiculous lol. 4) The tom kha soup was 99% lemon grass/coconut milk with zero flavor or spice, (& anyone who has had LOTS of tom kha knows that if a THAI chef can't get tom kha right then the rest of the menu is also bound to SUCK). But guess what? I never said a word about my bleh soup, my cold eggrolls, the thai tea OR the dirty plates.. UNTIL my bf complained about his garlic pepper chicken. We eat at countless restaurants all over the US, & this is the SECOND time I've ever seen him complain about his food. He will usually just leave it & not say a word, so I knew if he complained it was BAD. I don't eat meat, (but I did for 26 years) & trust me it did not look or smell appetizing. And when he brought it to the server's attention? She apologized but didn't offer to take it off the bill. Hmmm, probably because their either super greedy & don't give a F---- about their customers satisfaction, OR because they get a TON of complaints like this & can't afford to lose any more money. LOL She just said, "oh have you gotten this here before? Cause this is our recipe" to which I replied "so old, leftover rubbery chicken is your special recipe? You should have taken it off the bill cause you know he couldn't eat it!!"   It amazes me how server's can actually expect someone to pay for something that they didn't even EAT! I could not cheat my customers like that & let them leave dissatisfied. I advise anyone who appreciates quality food & service to avoid this place at all costs.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old, disgusting garlic pepper chicken. (And NO pepper).

3pVygkxfKXLB0LHmB0dWXQ.text: I've been a long time patron of Archi's Thai Kitchen but my experience this last time wasn't the best one. I recently moved back to Las Vegas and decided to make Archi's Thai Kitchen my first meal back in town after a long day of moving. After settling into my new place, I called and placed an order for stuffed chicken wings, papaya salad (som tam) and a spicy basil. The person who took my order said it would be about 25 minutes for my order to be ready so went to pick up my order just in time. When I pulled up to the drive thru window, no one came up to the window. I don't know if they have a sensor that alerts them of a car pulling up to their pick up window but that evening I waited to the window for about 10 minutes. An Archi's staff member saw me but went about his work without acknowledging that I was there waiting so I pulled around the building and parked my car in a parking spot and proceeded into the restaurant. The staff member that saw me at the window was at the front counter and I asked him if the drive thru window was out of service and he said "no". I asked him why I wasn't helped and he said he thought someone else was helping me. So clearly there is a communication problem among the staff or someone doesn't know how to do their job. He offered me a Thai Iced Tea on the house which I declined since I don't drink sweet drinks. After waiting for another 10 minutes my order came out and I took it home. The papaya salad and spicy basil tasted fine (these two dishes were ready when I got there) but the stuffed wings which came out last had a strange taste to it. Strangely enough the staff member who checked on my order went to the back and said the stuffed wings weren't ready but it had already been 35-40 minutes. I don't want to say it's because I gave them a hard time about me waiting at the drive thru window but the chicken tasted like they cooked it in mop water. It had a smell of old wet rag. My wife and I couldn't eat it so we threw it away. I haven't returned since this experience but I just hope they're not playing around with the customer's food. I've stayed in Thailand for almost 4 months so I know that the people there take their food seriously and don't mess around with customer's food but Archi's Thai Kitchen is in the US so I'm a bit skeptical about going back. I was contemplating on either giving them a 2 or 3 star rating but gave them 3 stars since two out of the three dishes were edible. Just a warning don't piss off their staff, you might get mop water chicken.

akspospF4UQeL8K5NC2sMA.text: I came here for the drive thru and thank goodness my coworker told me to call them, place the order then go so that it would be ready. the drive thru is not really a place to have orders made and wait it is more for just driving up and picking up.   As far as the food, it was really tasty and a little on the spicier side. I liked my red curry, I got a level 5 but probably should have gotten 4. Very flavorful and enjoyed the fried wanton and egg roll with the lunch menu.   I will be back.

KWx85u5B6tNt00OjXzayWg.text: Drive-through Thai. Sign me up please. Archi's is well known throughout the valley as having great Thai food. This particular location has a drive-through. It is perfect for nights when you just want to curl up and Netflix with some Thai food on the side. I always get the red curry with chicken spice level seven. It's just the right amount of heat with the perfect coconut milk wash. The Thai eggrolls always come out super crunchy and their house dipping sauce is really tasty.  A little mango and sticky rice always finishes the meal with a sweet flavoring finale. I highly recommend any Archi's in the valley, especially this one, on nights you don't feel like being presentable.

GKB0fnIKsDN9V-_wJNpkcA.text: Archi's is the best thai food in Vegas!!!! (In my opinion)   They never disappoint.   The food is always prepared fresh upon ordering it.   The service is perfect.  And the food is delicious!!   The W. Flamingo location is the only one I've ever been to.  I highly recommend the Pad See Ew, and the Yellow Curry is to die for!

0W8vm9C_qbfdYn5EVjxB3w.text: Archie's is my favorite Thai restaurant.  I would definitely travel to eat at the location. The food never disappoints . Yellow Curry and Tom Yum Seafood are my go to dishes. However the Satay chicken is such a delicious appetizer. Reasonable price and great customer service .

zujeOUgDXnLQpJqpmY1Beg.text: Due to many friend recommendations we decided to come in to give this Archi's location a try.     The ambiance of the restaurant is very nice and it seems pretty clean so that made me excited for our decision.      We were one of the only customers inside so we were seated quickly.  We also had a few different servers touch our table so it was a little confusing but we managed to get everything ordered in a timely fashion.   A star was lost for service though when it got busier and we spent a good 15 min trying to flash a server down.  We wanted dessert but didn't get it because we were waiting and then we ended up walking up to the register to pay because we had been waiting so long for the check and didn't want to wait any longer.   The food was good but not spectacular.   I'd say it was average good Vegas Thai food.   I've had worse and I've had better.   I will say that the spice level was on point here.   I get a 3 with papaya salad and a 5 to 7 with everything else and most places it all tastes the same no matter what number you give.   Overall,  I would come here again to taste more items given that the sizes were good and they know how to spice it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab fried rice - had a lot of crab but didn&#39;t taste of it
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad see we - loved the Chinese broccoli as it was cooked perfectly
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow curry

6O8J1yR2BD_GrMGbto8gqQ.text: Fresh.   Clean.  Crisp veggies.    We love their green curries and Tom Tom soup.   Kids love the pad Thai.   Food always tastes so fresh and well seasoned.   Word of caution---they will ask you on a scale of 1-10 how you like spice level.   I started with a 5 and there was fire coming out of my ears.   So now I'm a 3!  Highly Rec!

Inp7kPGyv4qUChIhyv8MOA.text: My friend took me here after work and raved about it. I could see some things she was talking about but mainly it wasn't anything different than any other local Thai restaurant.   Ambiance and decor is clean and crisp. Kinda has a tea house feel to it.  Cleanliness/Ambiance (4/5)  Walked in and a server sat us. I got a lemonade and my friend got a Thai tea.  She got some coconut broth based soup with shrimp and mushrooms and I got Pad Thai like I normally do. She got a 10 spice level and I got a 7. Neither being spicy. The food was good. They gave me extra peanuts like I asked for. Again, didn't taste anything different than other places. Make your level 10 spicier! Food (3/5)  Service was confusing I had multiple servers. A server took our drink menu away from us when my friend wanted to order a beer. The server had no clue what alcohol was on their own menu. Not a lot of personality going on there. Had a couple of times where we couldn't find a server at all and it was dead there. Had to get up to ask for the drink menu. Also had to stand up to get change because  no one was around. You shouldn't have to get up for anything during your dining experience, but twice?!?! Service (2/5)  Would I come back? Doubtful with all the other similar / closer places to me. Still worth a shot might get a good experience too.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai Chicken
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai Chicken
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tea house vibe?

1nw-1fXwzunxFPPbLrZ6fg.text: My first time dining at Archi's. The servicer was not attentive at all, not once did he check on we're doing or did not ask if we need refills. The food mediocre, I would never go back...

8gv70z6wP-RUHFyFTGzVPQ.text: The staff was friendly and the food was good.  I would recommend as a nice place for a leisurely lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice ambiance
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Specials @ Archi&#39;s
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Archi&#39;s Menu

KSVYYnDKJT7GSI9Y36y1pw.text: Great great service. I ordered Green Curry and it was way too spicy for my Woosey" tastebuds. I am a chicken when it comes to spice. Well they took it back to the kitchen to add cocoNut milk and it was still too strong so they changed it to pineapple rice. No extra charge and they were so nice about it. Try the pineapple rice. Yum!!

mNB6uZSuHrlZQOJbRzYgrg.text: Some of my favorite dishes... Tom Kha with shrimp (soup).  I order rice to go along with the soup as it is a large enough serving to be a meal.  Pineapple fried rice is chock full of goodies such as raisins, cashews, pineapple, and I prefer shrimp for the meat addition.  I've tried chicken satay at other thai restaurants and hands down my favorite is at Archi's.  If they would offer curry puffs I wouldn't need to go anywhere else.  Best Thai tea.  The lunch specials provide more than enough food, although I would like to be able to choose the soup that comes with it (it's soup of the day; no choices) as sometimes they serve a soup I don't care for.  I've always seen an "A" rating when I go there and service is consistently very good.  I can visit any of the Archi's restaurants and the food flavors are consistently very good.

7zy0A8b8bABzinWrpBpHTg.text: Very disappointed in my visit today. Me and my family use to go to the rainbow location all the time. Since that one was closed we went to the flamingo location. We were seated right next to the kitchen. No one came to get our order, we actually didn't even see someone who we could wave down in the kitchen. I actually had to call the front after about 20 minutes of no one coming. I told them we are the table in the back and no one has came. They didn't even apologize or offer any type of appetizer or something as an apology. Then when we went to order, me and my boyfriend alerted the server we were vegan. He pretty much told us that our food then would be bland because fish oil is what makes their flavor. I couldn't believe it. Every other restaurant, including the other location of Archie's has never said this or had the problem of making their food vegan and still taste good. It was ridiculous. We got the pad Thai and sweet and sour tofu. The pad Thai was good, but the sweet and sour tofu was awful. No other Thai or Asian restaurant I've encountered has had a problem with this dish being vegan. Then I asked for the spices like chili paste. They didn't have chili paste. We had to get up and ask three different people for the spice rack. It was the worst experience. Stay away, and take your business else where to the other new better Thai restaurants in town.

c9ELlU6sTSCEbch4Eg_3bQ.text: Food was not that good. Place could use some remodeling. Definitely fresh coat of paint on the walls wouldn't hurt. Window shutters were filthy.

GZkQDB4_liGEBk4Vx9NoXA.text: Best Thai I've ever had.    The Pad See Ew with pork was just ridiculously delicious and  flavorful.  I still dream about it.  The yellow curry with chicken is the best ever.    The Rad Nar is a little more muted in flavor than the others but was also very good and cooked well.  We were the only people in the restaurant, and the service was excellent.  I would make it a point to come here every time I'm in Vegas, it's that good.

24zkOuz5NOH6-Dzz30bauw.text: First let me say we eat at Flamingo and Rainbow locations. The food is 5 star in both places.  Last time at Flamingo place there was no hostess and I saw no sign about seating. We seated ourselves (2 of us) after 1 minute.  Lady came over with menu and told us in a nasty way we are not to seat ourselves in the future. We were so embarrassed we walked out. We have been coming to both locations for a while. Food is great both places, but now we only go to Rainbow.  If you get a bad hostess or waitress it ruins the meal.

AVwEhCs0jYgbNGALd5jkhA.text: Came here with my Elite yelping buddy Jewelyn.  Wow, the interior is very different from the one on Ft. Apache and Sahara.  The decoration or theme makes you feel as if you're in someones house and the seats are very comfortable.  Good service and a nice clean restaurant.  Now as far as the food goes, Archi's is one of the best thai food in Vegas.  Everything is good but my favorite, which I also recommend is the spicy eggplant (you have an option of which meat you'd like too add on it). There pad thai is is great too but the one in asian thai cuisine is slightly better, but still delicious nonetheless.   I recommend this Archi's over the other one because of its interior theme and comfortable eating.  It gets pretty busy during the evening so I suggest coming in the early afternoons so you can enjoy the food in peace.

n9gkQDssDDHJElSsxOE9nw.text: This was my 2nd time trying Thai food and it was NOTHING like the thai food ive tried before. . . AT ALL lol. i thought it was gonna taste somewhat like chinese food lol Cuz that's what it taste like the 1st time i had it in Cali. But it didnt. It was very different. We went for lunch and we got our food really fast. too fast maybe lol. I had the chicken pad thai and thai ice tea. The food was chewy. Idk if thats how it's supposed to be because again, i'm not really that familiar with thai food. It tasted kinda bland. Not saying it was bad tho. The tea was very strong and it tasted like if whatever caramel or sugar or whatever is they out in there, was burnt. when the ice melted i enjoyed it more. it was okay. Later on that night i was getting cravings for the pad thai sooooo... couldnt have been that bad, right? lol.

IIH-iSpMVFpJkmfTS8QdhQ.text: Best Thai food in town! My fiance and I go here every month to get Tom Yum soup and panang curry!

xeDwjUf1ttUNbDLbza6RDA.text: Nothing compares to this place. I've tried Thai from some areas in Long Beach/LA and i just don't really like how the food taste, I keep on thinking of Archi's and how great their food is. I just can't come to Vegas all the time to get Thai I guess... But when i am in town this is the one place I keep coming back to(been coming since Summer 2011). Def recommend, haven't tried all dishes but the ones i get are delicious (especially the Pad prik king).

m39SuErMRJIBYC3hipSq5A.text: Here is horrible Every customers will know they have a bad customer service. For sure they won't refill your drink and take care. I was really disappointed with their service. Also they have a lack of English. So It's hard to understand them. Foods are good. But service is terrible. They seemed to need money only. Don't have any sense and passion of working. They don't smile tho..

Zo-WpxHg8yredZI_h44wOw.text: The food was great and prices are reasonable. Wait staff had a hard time keeping up because it was busy, and bathrooms were not clean even though we got there when it opened, but hey, it happens. Would go again.

NJMVU--4QSrmVy-SkH5FPA.text: The best way to describe Archi's is consistently good Thai food.    I find myself eating Archi's at least once a week.  The recipes are excellent.  Great Pad Thai, Curry, Fried Rice, and sweet and sour pork.  The dinner prices are average but the lunch specials are great.  For $8 you can have the soup of the day, a spring roll, salad and your meal which is a very large portion.  The only inconsistency is the service.  Most days the service is friendly and fast but on an occasional busy lunch, the service can be slow and you may find yourself feeling unwanted.  I caution going to Archi's at exactly 12 noon.  Other than that one complaint, Archi's is near the top of the Las Vegas Thai food scene.

bhiDYwgoJarYE1DPiHVNcw.text: I love this place. Very authentic Thai food! I love how their angel wings ( stuff chicken wings) are baked instead of fried!!! Almost all the other Thai restaurants prepare this dish fried. So far, only Archi's is baked and they are really good!! They always prepare the pa wen San as how I like it. The soup is not loaded with sugar, so it is perfect And authentic. Some places add lots of sugar to everything, which effectively ruined the dish for me.   Really attentive staff. I don't go anywhere for Thai food except this place and the one on Sahara.

3I1yJG-429ZbxZLakJFsoA.text: I am a huge fan of Thai food.... wish the beer didn't match the price of a plate of food!

oNR0-a27QYVBb9baHbB8Qw.text: This place is great. Huge portions for the price, fast service, and the flavor is amazing. Have been here a few times and i have never been disappointed.

2aHLkZHMc2mDTgwrkSV53g.text: Like the other Archi's Thai restaurants in Vegas, this one does me right.   Now let me say this: the only Thai food I've ever had is Panang Curry, because I'm new to Thai food and that's what I had first, and it was delicious. I now use it as my bar to compare Thai food.  The Panang Curry is my favorite here of all the other places I've tried.  Pro-tip: they'll ask you if you want spicy level 1-10. If you're a fan of spicy food, it actually goes to 30 (in increments of 5 after 10). I get the 30. It's good.

UYOOdtO_4Hbee_MahlGMaw.text: My family and I have been going here for about 3-4 years and we absolutely love it. We get the same things every time (despite the increase in prices due to popularity). Staff pretty much know what we want by heart lol and they always recognize us when we stop by. They're friendly and considerate + getting your food never takes too long. I can't even think of a time they ever got our order wrong and it's a pretty large order considering my family's size! They're overall a great place and we always recommend them whenever anyone ask about local Thai food!

VwwEkQ8YpV5rcG2SLy29vQ.text: My husband and I have been coming here for years. Aside from Lotus it's the only Thai restaurant that we frequent. Service has always been good and the drive thru takeout is really convenient. We've ordered a lot of different things off the menu but our favorites are: Spicy Basil Chicken, Pad Kea Mow, Panang Curry, Choo Chee Shrimp and the Fish Cakes. Love the Thai tea too. Spice levels are sometimes inconsistent. Might be an issue for those more sensitive to spice. Great place for lunch!

H8eVGc1EEzxj7Y3RQJCFxw.text: This Archi's location is just down the street from my temporary housing arrangement, and I pass by it regularly on my way to my doctor's appointment.  It is located in a fairly old strip mall on W. Flamingo and timing was perfect today for me to drop in for a quick lunch and check out what Yelpers have said was a reasonably priced lunch special from a Thai restaurant.   When I arrived around 11:30am, there were already several tables occupied with diners having their lunch.  But I was quickly greeted by one of the petite waitresses and seated at a large table that can comfortably seat 4 or 6.  I felt a little guilty since I was dining alone.  But it didn't end up being an issue since the restaurant didn't get packed as I thought it was based on how hectic the place gets during the mad rush of the lunch crowd.  Anyway, I noticed that their selections of lunch specials is rather small compared to their entire menu offerings.  But I went with their Red Curry with Chicken and also ordered a Thai Iced Coffee.  The waitress soon returned with a really generous size glass of Thai Iced Coffee, it is definitely the largest glass of Iced Coffee I have ever been served. Happy Surprise = +1 on my Yelp meter.  The Red Curry with Chicken was alright.  The flavor of the curry and the 5 spiciness on the Thai spicy scale was good. But the chicken was really tough, and I didn't care for it at all. The egg roll served is 99% out of the box, and you can really taste the prominent white pepper in the filling or the wrapper.  Ambiance is good, the dining area is rather small, but it didn't bother me. And during lunch there was good amount of ambient lighting from outside, which I believe is a good thing.  Anyway, I am going to have to come back and try some more of the cooking of the Thai mothers and grandmothers working in the back. Because I was seated at the table facing the small window where the kitchen passes the prepared plates to be served, and all I see are a bunch of women on the other side working in the kitchen.

RH91jW--HiFrjSabMnQxAQ.text: We usually go to the one on Rainbow and Sunset if possible. But for Lunch orders to be picked up, this place is the best. Usually a few people are in the dinning room, but super quiet. They have seating in the back and it's totally awesome back there.   Their staff is amazing and have never said no when asking for extra chop sticks or sauces. I'll always be a fan!

fX0imHaqwHoO0QBTXjPTqw.text: Love Archie's lunch menu! I usually go to  the Rainbow and 215 location, but decided to make a stop at this location for lunch today because I had heard the cooking style here is better. But honestly I couldn't tell the difference.   My usual lunch order is the red curry with chicken. I ordered spicy #4 on today's visit and whoa was it spicy for my taste. The order of thai tea sure helped! Their lunch items average anywhere from $7.95-9.95 and it comes with your normal soup, salad, eggroll, fried crunch, rice, and entree of choice. Very filling :)  The wait staff was friendly and the restaurant itself was clean, although I think I prefer the newer & more spacious rainbow and 215 location.   Overall I definitely recommend this place for thai food!

vuMbwv7weyzj7ywbgDWr_g.text: Can't get enough of the chicken pad thai and an ice cold thai tea. Customer service is a bit short of what I expect but the food is delicious.

88oQKrVme-iM1KgfuoV3FQ.text: Best spicy basil pork dish in Las Vegas.  Has subtle spicy and basil taste.  With ground meat.  Pork requires longer cook time than beef/chicken so the meat gets infused with the seasoning.  Chicken was good, but pork was better.   I like my spicy basil dish dry, not wet, and for the most part, Archi's does make the dish dry.  A wet dish means it wasn't cook long enough to infuse the meat with the flavors.  Unfortunately, the dish is inconsistently cook (sometimes wet and not as flavorful) so removing one star.  The other dishes that I tried were ok, but I didn't try many because I almost always got my favorite dish.  Note that the restaurant sign outside does not light up "Archi's", only "Thai Kitchen".  So when you are looking for it in the dark, concentrating on finding a restaurant named Thai Kitchen because the Archi's is invisible.  Parking is plentiful out front (strip mall).    The restaurant inside is warm and comfortable.  Service is very friendly.

NEtmImPA5CPjYQ6uZ736uw.text: Mood- dinner   Upon entering was quickly greeted with great customer service. Was ushered over to a booth which I prefer. Given menu and asked regarding beverages.  Opted for the stuffed chicken, cashew nut dish,  beef panang, and an Arnold palmer. The stuffed chicken came with a plum dipping sauce which was really good, and the cashew nut had a great flavor to it.   Interior was very clean, several tables and booth options. My beverages were constantly refilled. There was music playing in the background.  Would recommend- pricing is reasonable,  portions are nice. They have great lunch specials too.  Location is Flamingo/ Torrey Pines- ample parking

ufMrAfnPq_Hy6tAWW0BFIw.text: Came here with the fam and had a pleasant meal.  The food was just average and not spicy enough for my liking.  The staff was friendly and attentive and the portions are on the larger size.   Check it out and compare for yourself.

PKLTLjQAN6eF383855YX-g.text: Obviously it's not Lotus, but its not a fair comparison. I mean we don't compare Ruth's Chris to steaks at Applebee's right?  So for a regular hole in the wall type of Thai Restaurant this is by far the best Thai food in the west coast.  I've ordered just about everything on the menu and every single one has been great.  So if you're the typical white person who always orders pad Thai or a more adventurous person that goes deep in the menu, you absolutely will not be disappointed.   I usually go to the location on Rainbow, but this place is great as well.  By the way...careful with the door. It gets hot.

XrO2wdHNn-EfMn5L5S6DYg.text: This is definitely worth coming off the strip for some very good Thai. The kaffir lime flavor really stood out in the curries. My friends from Philly were very impressed.   A local had told me about Archi's a few years ago and I've come here or the Bistro location every visit to Vegas since.  So grateful.

HrZOe-QCfFn1e4cRAZqVjg.text: This is a good Thai restaurant! I happen to be on Flamingo when I saw Archi's Thai Kitchen. I quickly made a turn in the Phoenix Plaza and this restaurant is located next to a bakery. I was seated right away and their menu has a good selection of salad, soup, seafood, noodles, rice and curry. You have an option to make your entree as vegetarian or you can pick your choice of protein like chicken, pork, beef, or tofu. I notice they have mochi ice cream as part of their dessert and there are just a few beverage I see like Thai iced tea, coffee, juice, and soft drinks.   I request for hot tea ($1.95) to go with my order and got the Spicy Basil ($10.95). For this entree, you have an option which meat you want and I opt for ground chicken, which is sauteed with zucchini, bell peppers, garlic, chili, fresh basil and it's serve with steamed rice. Food arrive within 15 minutes and the Spicy Basil Chicken taste amazing! The meat is season well and full of delicious basil flavor, it has the right amount of heat and not too spicy. I like how the vegetables are nicely sauteed with the meat making this dish very satisfying. I highly recommend ordering this entree for your first visit.   For appetizers, I had Thai Egg Rolls ($5.95) which are deep fried egg rolls stuffed with clear noodles and vegetables and it's serve with plum sauce that looks similar to a sweet chili sauce. The eggs rolls are serve hot and it is very crunchy. I actually like the noodles inside these egg rolls, it's quite tasty but I wish there is an option to add some of that spicy basil chicken, it will definitely make it a lot more appetizing!   I thought about getting Mochi Ice Cream but I was told they did not have any in stock, not even mango. So the only option left is Sweet Sticky Rice with Coconut Ice Cream ($7.95). When the server brought my dessert, I am amaze it looks like an ice cream sundae. Yay! The sweet sticky rice is sprinkled with toasted yellow mung beans and it is serve with a triple scoop of that yummy coconut ice cream topped with a maraschino cherry. It taste so good! I can't get enough of that coconut ice cream. I left the restaurant very happy and with a full tummy. Service is somewhat slow, but oh well the food is excellent and right now that is all that matter.

iMtt-oCG9cMgQ-7CPLFsPQ.text: I've been going here for years. I live the fried tofu and pad thai. Huge serving size for lunch! The soup is very good too! Please put more tofu in the pad thai! It's so much noodles and not enough tofu!

TTa0IdfNg6wwyzEUAwVS5A.text: Not as good as I remembered it to be, this was my go to Thai resto when I used to live in the area. I have been craving this place for awhile and finally got the chance to come, excited to take my mom and kids for the first time also. Unfortunately was a bit disappointed. Ordered my usual green curry, it was very soupy, pad thai was ok, pad see ew was good and spring rolls was also ok. There's more resto in this side of town that I'd go first before ever coming back.

PsUlJM700kNyGcqXuKur_A.text: Very good Thai food. Their fried egg rolls were excellent. Some of the best I've had. The Papaya salad was very good. Shrimp Pad Thai was ok but a little dry. The chicken fried rice (kowpot) was good but lacked sufficient protein and was missing the signature cucumber slices that differentiate True Thai kowpot from Chinese fried rice. Overall the food was 4+ stars but the service and speed deserves 5 stars. We lived in Thailand for a year and this is a good sampling of their culture.   Update: went back for a late dinner. Food was all poor quality. They added raw green beans to the Papaya salad which ruined the taste completely. It was actually quite horrible. We tried the Pad Thai again and again it was dry. They completely forgot about our last dish we ordered and didn't bring it until prompted by us. It was Mongolian beef which was not at all. Maybe the beef but they added it to a sweet and sour mix of veggies that were part raw and part over cooked. Bad experience all around for a semi-expensive meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding Papaya Salad
Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An excellent meal

q6detENYMNnawDnZQTPkxg.text: I never tried Archi's since I already have my favorite Thai restaurant that I've been going to for the last few years. One night when I was craving for my usual Pad Thai and Thai Iced coffee, my "fave Thai restaurant" was already closed for the evening. I am a huge fan of DoorDash so since Archi's was still open for delivery, I eventually ordered from them and I was so impressed with the quality of food (so FRESH), the generous portions (I was AMAZED) and speed of preparation because my Dasher was so quick to deliver my food  that Archi's is now #1 in my !!! By the way, their iced coffee is sooo good as well!

D03Uge5C6nKiSAm8jSToJg.text: Otdered lunch takeout red curry and thai tea.  It was spiced perfectly and was delish!  Definitely woth repeat visits.

qswquIatsh2EydK2VpzKiQ.text: Really good Thai food. The crab fried rice is especially good. I also have to recommend many of the noodle dishes. I haven't had a dish there yet that I did not like.  The price is average. Also dining in was very nice. The staff was lovely and of course the decor and atmosphere was nice. I'm realizing this is normal when it comes to Thai food.

FqvIizpbodHZZ9zeA8I42w.text: I come to this Archies a lot and after my last experience I will not be coming back here.   The meat was undercooked and showed blood, when bringing up to the server they couldn't care less and didn't do anything? Not even an apology.   Wouldn't redo the dish, wouldn't refund the dish?   I was extremely Irritated and asked for the manager, the server said there is no manager?   We ordered about $60 worth of food and literally paid the bill and left before enjoying the meal.   I tipped $0.01 for the worst service I have experienced in my life, to not take of the dish or even re-do it, I'm blown away how bad a business entity can do business and no managers to resolve this issue.   I don't recommend coming to this Archies at all!

eu0Ax0kBv7WR-fMIjGzbmw.text: Delicious. I had Chicken Pad Kee Mao. I love spicy food so I got a level 10/10 for spice. It was still full of flavor. The waiters had good customer service. I will be back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Archi's Thai Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

enIczL7jRcW3bHKwbywE0Q.text: I really want to give props to our servers. I've got to admit, the customer service at this restaurant exceeded my expectations. The servers were very patient was our large party, even when we requested to switch tables due to the sunshine shining through the windows and basically blinding us from seeing anything. Not only were they patient, they were also very informative in helping us order and had a sense of humor.  We ordered Red Curry with Chicken, Pad Thai with Seafood, Pad See-Ew with Beef, Tom Yum with Chicken, and two Thai Ice Teas. I particularly enjoyed the Pad See Ew and the Tom Yum. Their Pad See- Ew and Pad Thai weren't excessively greasy, like many places I've been to before. The Pad See-Ew was perfectly flavored, not too sweet nor savory. The Tom Yum was so refreshing, with a balance of spice and sourness.  I enjoyed my visit at Archi's Thai Kitchen. Parking, food, and service were all amazing! If you're looking for a good thai restaurant in Vegas, make sure to make a visit at this restaurant! Your taste buds would thank you.

phqyXgFqpDnva5DIXhOwgw.text: Got a little hungry so we stopped by here for some thai. Made in time for the lunch special. Husband got red curry wth white rice. I got beef pad thai. Each lunch special came with veggie egg roll, salad, and fried crunch wonton looking thing. Both was okay. Portion is pretty huge. My pad thai was a little too sweet for me. Red curry is missing a little something in my opinion. We also got a thai tea which was BOMB. Must get. Friendly staff. Service was on point. They also had a drive thru.

h6Hzwp3omM3YTxIqv5cSeg.text: Love Thai food and have passed Archi s many times. Lunch special included soup and there was a nice variety of Thai dishes to choose from. I ordered the spicy basil with ground pork at a 10 spice level. The food was decent and the service was ok. For a 10 spice level it didn't really challenge my taste buds. Not bad.

2S_zGldoNw3a7cKAfr1twA.text: Love love love Archi's!!! I adore Thai food and this place really gives me my fix. Amazing chicken pad Thai and sweet and sour chicken along with so many other dishes. The service is always amazing when we eat on as well. Thanks Archi's!!

4G2lQW8PT1sIV8ay9m1K8A.text: The original location since 2007 it's been 4 yrs since I visited Las Vegas and And this restaurant's quality for great Thai food has not changed. From the shrimp pad Thai, pineapple fried rice and Thai ice tea this restaurant is still my top favorite in Las Vegas. They have several locations now and all measure up to their authentic Thai cooking. Vegas is a staple of excellent cuisine I've been to many Thai restaurants in California, Nevada and Michigan this place is my top 3 under Thai food category. Try their panang it's a type of curry sauce it's so good along with their papaya salad everything is good here I promise.
